user_review: This is my favourite steakhouse in Montréal and if not ever! The service is always impeccable, the wine list is extensive and not pretentious, the food is over the top and the steaks are just to die for. The restaurant used to be a horse stable and is one of the oldest restaurants in the heart of Old Montréal. My favourite thing on the menu is the rib steak At gibby's you order a main and it includes an appetizer and a 'palette cleanser' (a scoop of house made sorbet). I highly recommend the gibby's salad; their dressing is to die for! You can also just purchase the dressing by itself for $6. I've been doing this over the pandemic and make the gibby's salad at home. Best decision ever! The main also includes a side along with your protein - i highly recommend the montecarlo potato (twice baked with bacon and sour cream). Oh of course we can't forget about their pickles and bacon and the AMAZING homemade bread. I'm usually way too full by the time my main comes because their salad, bread and pickles are just too good and I always forget to save room for the main.Atmosphere is very intimate but a bit rustic and old school. I like it, but it's not a 'modern trendy vibe'. Dimmed lights, dark colours and stone / brick walls. Value/price 4.5/5Food/quality 5/5Portion 5/5Service 5/5Overall: 5/5Love love love this place!

Dynamite.  Easily the best restaurant I've eaten at in Montreal.  Went with the Wellington and house potato.  Had the crab cake (it's one very large delicious crab cake) and I wish I ordered 73 of them.  The waiter was so efficient he had a drink in front of me when he heard the ice in my glass clink from across the room with his super sonic hearing.  Lol.  (Took the metro when I left FYI). Seriously outstanding service and the food is delicious.  An absolute delight and we will be back.

Haven't been. Won't ever go. PeriodCalled this evening to pay for my sisters birthday dinner with my credit card. The young girl who answered was polite, but the "Manager" was curt and rude. "Too much fraud". End of story. This is not the first time I have done this when she has been away and I have not been able to celebrate her birthday with her ON the actual day. This "Manager" should probably learn the value of good customer service ESPECIALLY in the post-COVID market economy. There was a 25% tip waiting for the server for their trouble. Shame this poor management can't go the extra mile for anyone. Perhaps it was because I mentioned I was from Toronto. More likely he just couldn't be bothered.  Harbour Sixty in Toronto is MUCH better service, and probably better food.

Went here for takeout and was not disappointed.I had to get the French Onion Soup and garlicky salad dressing.  Everything came packaged extremely well and was easy to make at home.  The soup was divine... with loads of cheese.  The salad came with the best dressing on the side... so I had to order a few more bottles.  I did not try the other menu options.

I was visiting Montreal for my bday and a friend recommended this restaurant. We made a rsvp and was lucky to find it because it was packed when we got there. Service was amazing and food was delicious. I had steak, my gf had the lobster. Both were perfectly cooked. The waiter was really attentive even though he has a full house. Overall the experience was really nice and even brought me a happy bday cake - big one actually.Thank you for an amazing evening.

Heard so much about Gibbys; while I was in Montreal for a wedding I had to visit.Made a reservation and thankfully so, they were crazy busy.The environment and dining experience was world class. The food was just amazing, I cried a little when my steak melted in my mouth. I don't even know how that was remotely possible to make a medium rare steak that just fall apart when chewed. Gibby's definitely takes the #1 spot for steaks in my books.Do visit the spot when in Montreal, you won't be disappointed. Their staffs, environment and menu offerings are way too surreal. The other meals were just as amazing.

This place is getting three stars for the food. If it was based off service alone, I'd give it a one.We made reservations a month prior for a Thursday night at 7pm. The ambiance reminds me of a cozy old school steakhouse. We were seated immediately and greeted by our waitress. She seemed like she was in a hurry and this would continue throughout our meal until the very end when it was time for the check. I would expect a higher quality of service from a fancy steakhouse, but unfortunately that was not the case.Our table was right in front of the waiter station. So there was constant movement around our table which included NUMEROUS waiters bumping into the back of my chair. One time my hair must've been in the way because it was pulled as well. We had bread, bacon bits, and pickles brought out to the table first. Then came our salads, which we both enjoyed. It has a nice zesty Italian dressing.I ordered the ribeye and my boyfriend got the sirloin. My steak was cooked as requested, medium rare, but my boyfriend's came out more well done. My steak was good, but I've had better. Very disappointing for the price point. We both ordered the monte carlo potato for our side and it was pretty good. The asparagus was forgettable.We decided to skip dessert, based off our dining experience, but you're given some chocolates at the end of the meal if that excites you. The restroom is also upstairs. Not a big deal, unless you're wearing a dress/skirt and have someone below look up as you're walking up the stairs /:There needs to be more emphasis on service and food quality before I'd ever recommend this establishment.Also...move that table.

Gibby's is as good as I remember it to be. I've been coming here (on rare special occasions) since my father lived in Montreal in the 90s.It is probably my favorite steakhouse in the world. The combination of the great location in old Montreal, great ambiance and good price for high end delicious steak, and great service. The restaurant also has a unique charm. It is a special place and a jewel of old Montreal rather than a tourist trap. Not to mention that unlike other most steakhouses, the delicious steaks come with a generous crispy salad and a tasty sorbet (to cleanse the palate prior to the main course steak). Gibbys has an old world atmosphere and a nice courtyard in the back it shares with some old Montreal businesses. On our recent visit, my family played there as we waited for our table. It's a nice space for kids to run around and adults to enjoy the atmosphere. Almost like a hidden little gem, which by the way Montreal is full of by the way. Unfortunately these are becoming increasingly rare in my hometown, NYC. They have complimentary valet parking, which we didn't take advantage of as we took a nice walk over from the nearby famous Notre Dame cathedral in old Montreal.The steak we ordered was the bone in ribsteak but our waiter, Jeff ended up giving us the boneless ribeye - one of his 2 gaffes of the evening. The other being not telling us ahead of time that the mediocre kids pasta was a whopping $30. He was otherwise a personable and very good server.The steak was simply delicious. Not  salty and super buttery like they serve at Ruth's Chris or Mastro's. It was lightly seasoned but the steak quality and flavor of the meat itself was incredible.The accompanying Montecarlo double baked potato was really delicious too. Super soft and fluffy and nicely dressed with bacon, and a bit of sour cream and chives. Everyone loved it and we got it with each of our steaks. We also had the beef wellington filet mignon, which was as delicious as I remembered it. Upon ordering it Jeff told us the wellington usually takes longer for to come outfrom the kitchen than other steaks. It was cooked medium though we had wanted it medium rare. Jeff offered to replace it if we wanted it cooked medium rare and I was surprised when he said the new one would be out in only 10 minutes. We decided to just eat the one we got.It was fabulous and continues to be one of my favorite steaks anywhere.The steak is topped with mushrooms and a layer of puff pastry covers the entire thing. The flavors just enhance each other very well. A side order of spicy jalapeño sausages was on it $13.75 and had a super delicious smoky spicy flavor. I should have figured that anything meat related would be top notch at this high end steakhouse.Creme brulee and crepe jubilee dessert were both excellent.

Glad we called for reservations the restaurant filled up pretty quickly. The pickles were excellent they brought in the beginning. The palate cleanser before the ribeye was also excellent. The ribeye was ok. My husband and I love Ribeyes so this was just ok. Same with the desserts.. they were big and we should have shared one... hubby had the chocolate dessert and said it was just ok. I had the cream brûlée which was good but a lot for me to finish. The service was top shelf.

I really wanted to rate this place higher but honestly the experience was average at best for a premium steakhouse. We somehow managed to snag the absolute worst table in the place, downstairs between the door and the service table. I might have preferred sitting in the hallway by the coat check...The wine list was good and had a nice selection of reasonably priced reds. I ended up with a 2016 Petit Manou which turned out to be a very good value. The food was solid but not worth the price of admission. The bread and pickles were meh, the 12 oz. fillet was a perfect medium rare and the twice baked potato was quite good. The Bearnaise sauce lacked flavor and depth. The steak, although cooked perfectly, was under-seasoned and somehow dry. Portion sizes were huge.I was hoping for a better experience at Gibby's. I walked away thinking my grandfather would have loved this kind of place.

Pretty good. We waited a few hours in the bar area upstairs because we didn't have reservations on Christmas night. It was comfy and quiet and spacious. The food itself was decent. The service and quantity was more impressive. My salmon picture was blurry but it was pretty good. The gazpacho and oysters were good. The atmosphere was great but the food wasn't unforgettable.

Gibbys Atmosphere , food and services was awesome.  They are on par with the best restaurants in NYC, Vegas, and Toronto steakhouses I been too.I ordered the steak wellington and it is on par with the one I had  at Ramsay's Hells Kitchen.  My friends had the Gibby Ribeye Medium rare and they said it was juicy and compared well to the best they had.  Everyone thanked me for choosing this location as a stops.  The appetizers, deserts was amazing too.  Make you you try the Gibbys chocolate delight desert which is layer with chocolate and crunch.I had high expectation for this restaurants as on earlier tourist stops, we told people we met that we planned our dinner at Gibbys and everyone one said yeah that is one of the best in Old Montreal.Prices are on premium side but you get what you paid for.

Service was incredible, as was the food! I was dining alone and arrived at 6:00pm before the restaurant got too busy. I ordered food immediately, and enjoyed the warm bread and creamy butter. The house salad was delicious, and they gave me a taste of lemon sorbet after I was finished. I ordered my steak medium and the server offered to add some extra spices to it, which was delicious. I ate every bite and enjoyed their house dessert, which was very rich!

Atmosphere : old rustic feel , it's a very old country charming feel. It's as if you're going to your chalet far north but in the old port of montreal...Fancy and comfy as soon as you enter you feel like you travelled back in time.Free Valet parking is always great and efficient Service: A1 from the valet jockeys to the hostess and waiters , the service is amazing and attentive even when it's busy beyond belief.We were seated at a great table secluded and we were happy we could hear each others voices talk.Food: Amazing and deeelicious.I had started with their clam chowder soup, it's my favourite here they really are generous from the way they plate it in front of you to the rich creamy broth you indulge in , it was superbe. We had some Rockefeller Oysters melted in my mouth.For my main, I had their eggplant Parmesan with rice pilaf decided to go vegetarian that night lol (kind of) definitely worth it and I was full! It was really good and generous portions.Overall, Gibbys is a classic Montréal landmark and if you have not been here you're definitely missing out. It's one of the best restaurants and definitely worth a treat to visit. Cheers!

I think the last time I came here must of been 5 years ago. I'm sad to say that they did switch up the uniforms which I find to be blah now just a regular black apron. Back in the day they used to wear these burgundy long dresses that made the women look like they were collecting milk on the farms.Our waitress wasn't the best she just seem to not be happy or she didn't like us which she had no reason not to be especially when we are there paying a hefty price. Just very blah attitude a fake smile and super quiet when she came around our table. Yikes. We were a group of 6 tucked away in the back beside the window not a very loud spot as we came at 6 pm so the louder Saturday night crew of people hadn't arrived yet.We started with cosmos which were ready in a heart beat and than of course we jumped right in to our mains. I got the steak teriyaki and chose the Monte Carlo Potato which is pretty much the best double baked potatoes of life. (Ask for sour cream ) The asparagus were bland nothing to wow me over. Steak was cooked medium exactly how I like it and the sauce that cameWith my steak was (teriyaki) it was very sweet so didn't eat much of that.I noticed our waitress didn't offer the different salad dressings which should be told to you I mean since I've been going there I know the options but if you're a out of towner or a newbie it would be nice to know they have Gibbys, French, blue cheese etc. (You're welcome)The best part of the dinning experience is the bread and pickles everyone loves them, I mean can you really go wrong with fresh warm bread and big pickles ? It's not my favourite spot for a steak personally I know a lot places that are better and cheaper but Gibbys is just a thing to do or to say hey guess where I went. It's not all that. Valet crew was yelling in the streets at people which was kind of weird when we were waiting for our uber nobody wants to hear yelling pipe down.Would I go back ? Yes Of course still not my top places to eat in mtl tho.

I cannot recommend this "establishment" due to the poor service. I reserved a table for two for a special occasion a month in advance. When we arrived, we were ushered into a peripheral room and a table that was poorly located. There were many other nicer tables in the center of the restaurant, where the ambiance was much nicer. You'd think reserving one month ahead of time would guarantee a good table but guess again. Because of the poor placement of our table, people were constantly passing by and disturbing us. Even the waiters weren't paying attention when coming and going. I was personally shoved twice during my meal and our table was hit at least 5 times, and once our cutlery fell on the floor due to the impact. Service was barebones: took our order and brought our food and drinks. The most basic service I have ever received at an "institution" that prides itself for its reputation. At least it was easy to catch the waiter's attention when we needed him, because he kept on passing by. The steaks were above average, but certainly nothing to write home about and not particularly memorable. For the price that we paid, it was not worth it. In summary:Despite reserving one whole month in advance, we were giving arguably the worst table in the restaurant even though there were much better tables available.  Now I don't know for sure, but I suspect that our original table was switched by the host who greeted us. If that is the case, then this would be called profiling and is something that I do not condone. If this is not the case, then there's no point in reserving ahead of time because you end up with a bad table anyway. I apologize if this review seemed harsh -- maybe we got really unlucky that day -- but at the end of the day, it was supposed to be a special occasion and our experience here was more than just a fly in the ointment. In my humble opinion, for the price, there is no excuse for how we were treated and I will not return.

We came here on the weekend. First time being here and hopefully not the last. As we were walking in, I held the door open for easily 10-15 people. Not one said thank you. So that's the crowd that goes here.... (not Gibby's fault!)Service was excellent! Food amazing! Piping hot. I loved the pickles at the beginning of the meal. We ordered the escargot. It was very good and now I'm looking at buying an escargot dish online. Haha! The salad was surprisingly good! My boyfriend (now fiancé as he proposed later that night) usually doesn't eat salad unless it's Caesar, and he cleared the plate. The dressing was very good. The steak was perfect and the Monte Carlo potato...I will have dreams about it. It was so creamy and rich. We took what we didn't eat home with us and ate it the next night. Nice little celebration again as newly engaged for the following evening at home. Highly recommend going here.

Relatively affordable fancy dining. The fillet mignon was $60, but it starts with pickles and fresh bread, comes with a nice sized yummy salad, a pallet cleansing lime sorbet, the Monte Carlo (twice baked) potato and even cute little chocolates at the end. I feel like this is the place you go to celebrate a birthday or other event. The building is beautiful to boot as it's an old stable in old Montreal. They even have valet included... Cause dealing with parking would be a total bummer before going to eat at a place like this. On top of it, there is great service. Not the best steak I've eaten (hence the 4 not a 5) but still solid.

First time here and our experience was phenomenal. Service was top notch. Food was amazing for us too. Their bread was sooo good! Crispy outside and super soft inside. It had a little sweet to it. My lobster dinner and rice was perfectly seasoned & cooked. Their MUSSELS PROVENÇALE was so good, it's oven baked with French shallots, garlic and crumbled baconSalad was so fresh not one welt in the spinach or lettuce. Oil vinegaratte dressing was not too tangy. Family ordered their ribeye and fish entree and they all loved it. Totally recommend this place.

It has been a few years since my last visit to Gibby's so was looking forward to this meal.We arrived at 6:30-early for dinner by Montreal standards so it was quiet.Located in Old Montreal. It is a cozy and rustic restaurant with wood throughout.  Great atmosphere with a cabin/ski lodge feel.We started with their Jumbo shrimp & Garlic Escargot.  Huge shrimp with excellent cocktail sauce.  The decadent, garlic, buttery Escargot were exceptional.  We paired the starters with a local Amber IPA- St. Ambroise-which was light and not too hoppy.Next was the Caesar Salad with Anchovies-excellent!   We both ordered the "Gibby's cut" with the twice baked potatoes.  We added the spice and pepper topping.  The bone-in ribeye looked like a tomahawk & came out a perfect medium rare.  The meat was tender & the added spice topping gave it just the right added punch.  Use your table bacon bits on the potato-you won't be disappointed.  We paired dinner with a J. Lohr Cabernet which was excellent!The Key Lime Pie is a specialty so had to try it.  Good for sharing and tasty!  We had a couple of servers that took care of us and all of them were exceptional.  Offering to take pictures and refilling our wine glasses with just the right amount of check-Ins between courses.You can buy a bottle of the steak spice on the way out.  Epic meal & by 9 when we were finished it was full so reservations are recommended.

Came by here on our last night in Montreal to celebrate Kev's B'day and we were not disappointed!What more can I add to this review that has not been said already! We were warmly greeted on arriving and led to the cellar level and seated immediately.Our server SAMUEL was a delightful young man who was most attentive and that in itself made our dining experience so much more enjoyable right of the bat!We started with a couple of appetizers, the Curried Shrimp and the Mussels Provençal and they were very good.The bread was fresh and warm and the salad was crisp spot on ... my anchovies sealed the deal.For our main course the 3 of us had the Gibbys Steak and Dust had the Beef Wellington..... we all found our meals done to perfection.They bought a small cake out for Kev which we shared and it was Deelish!Having frequented many Steakhouses in the States and considering myself a Steakhouse Officinado I can with out any hesitation say Gibbys is as good as it gets!YES WE WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK on our next trip to Montreal!!

Amaziiiiing restaurant!!!! We loved everything about this place. We were group of 7, with kids. The service was great - our waiter Kas was so responsive to all our requests and had a great sense of humor.  The food was  beyond expectations amazing, the service, the atmosphere. The deserts were so so good. The creme brule is wow! The sorbet is also amazing. Highly recommend this place.

Looking for an old world Steak House experience while in Montreal? I suggest you stop at Gibby's. A respected Old Montreal establishment,​ most of the Gibby's structure was built at different points from 1765 to 1850; it was renovated in 1967 along with many other historical buildings in the tourist trap known as Old Montreal. This Steakhouse is actually part of what was once called the Youville Stables and is now known as a top steakhouse in Montreal. Known for their outstanding red meat and thick cuts, going to Gibby's is an expensive night out, but it is worth the coin. Walking through the doors you immediately get a sense of the history behind the building and the amount of seriousness the kitchen and staff put into their product. The hosting is swift and nimble (and uses a written card system straight out of 1920), the servers are gregarious while rushed and the dining room is packed & loud. Even the menu is probably too busy for its own good but Gibby's almost asks "If you can do it at a high level, why not?". Oh, and get reservations because you'll need them. All main courses are served with a choice of "Gibby's Salad" (Anchovies on request), or the Soup of the day. I chose to try the Gibby's Salad which is a rather simple affair with their signature Dressing that is also bottled and sold at the restaurant. This is remarkable in today's "a la carte" times that try to squeeze every penny of revenue out of the appetizers, side dishes, and most fiendishly to date - tap water. In the middle of the table, a bowl of the famous Gibby's ultra sour Pickles and a loaf of freshly baked Bread taunted me throughout the meal almost begging me to overeat. And I did. For my main, I opted for the magnificent Filet Mignon of Beef Wellington thanks to the suggestion of a neighboring table 's hard push. This culinary madman includes an 8-10 ounce cut of perfectly medium rare Filet that comes covered with Mushrooms Duxelle and wrapped in a gloriously golden brown Puff Pastry which is served with Bordelaise Sauce from the heavens for dipping (or slathering). The lot of it must weigh close to a pound - preposterous I know - but it gets better still...Flanking any meat course is a mandatory threesome of Asparagus Spears and Tomato that you will undoubtedly ignore but their partner called the "Potato Monte Carlo" is what will have you screaming for mercy. This is a half of a Russet that is Double baked with Bacon, Sour Cream, and Chives that is as addictive as cigarettes seem to be in Quebec and probably just as healthy. The issue is you just keep eating until the plate goes away. You have been advised. (Note to California: This all come at you for just over $50.00. Try that at home.) I know some will scoff at the crowd and I will be the first to admit it is "mature" and "fussy". Okay, let's be real - this would be my father's favorite restaurant in Canada. That doesn't mean Gibby's doesn't crank out an astonishing product and deserves a stop while in the area. I saw 2 Hawaiian shirts and 3 pieces of Supreme in my 20-foot sight radius alone so don't get worked up about the stuffiness. Gibby's is for the people. In a city with so many culinary options, this Steakhouse really ought to be on your radar.j

One of my favorite dinning experiences in Montreal. The restaurant itself is interesting as it is in a renovated historic stable, and it plays this up quite a bit in the decor. The food came out in courses starting with oddly enough whole pickles. I'm a pickle gal so I loved this. My husband was confused so I just ate his pickles. I ordered a steak medium rare & my husband got the Beef Wellington, which had a lovely flaky crust and a perfectly pink center. Overall very well done. If you get the baked potato side, definitely get the Monte Carlo. It's like a twice baked potato and it's Oh. So. Good.The service was excellent and lived up to a fine dining experience. I was nervous because we were traveling with our 5 month old baby and I wasn't sure if the staff would be comfortable with us eating with him, but they were very accommodating and allowed us to bring our stroller right next to the table so the baby could sleep.

Gibby's is without a doubt as good as it gets. Not only as a restaurant, but also as a life experience.The restaurant is unapologetically unhip, rustic, and old-fashioned. From the minute you are escorted your table, it is clear that you are a VIP guest being closely looked after. Virtually everything served is made in house. They do not cut corners here and for their efforts they are rewarded with endless customer loyalty.Upon sitting, you are immediately served with a loaf of delicious home baked bread that is still hot and has the consistency of pastry. Spread with butter and the complimentary homemade bacon bits, it's like biting into the forbidden apple in the garden of Eden.You are also supplied with a never ending supply of dill pickles as well as full fat cottage cheese with chopped green onions (upon request). Up to this point, there is no charge for anything listed in this review.Pair the free bites with a stiff drink or three and you are already well positioned for a great evening. Then comes the famous Gibby's salad included with every meal. It is a fairly simple salad composed of mixed greens and tomatoes. Where it excels however is with the addition of the homemade garlic dressing, homemade croutons, fresh cracked pepper, and anchovies (on request). After a few slices of the bread with butter, bacon bits, pickles, and salad, usually someone at the table will say that they are full and don't even need a main course. Ignore these people for surely they are deeply unhappy and damaged. They might even be a danger to themselves and the public.The steaks here are both humongous and divine. While they don't get the same level of caramelization on the crust as some classic American steakhouses, they do come with spices and chopped garlic upon request and are usually cooked to perfection. From memory, they have 2 sizes of filet mignon, a gigantic sirloin, and the mighty ribsteak. Other spectacular dishes are the rack of lamb served in the classic style with classic mint jelly, shish kebab, and beef Wellington. On the seafood side, their butterfly shrimp is spectacular. You are served with about 8 or 9 huge butterflied shrimp which are lightly dusted with garlic breadcrumbs and served with garlic butter. They also have lobster tails, and fresh fish which is well prepared....but seriously, don't ruin your life by ordering the fish. We're here for a good time, not a long time.Each meal is also accompanied by a side. Gibby's signature side is the Monte Carlo potato which consists of a twice baked potato prepared with sour cream and bacon. It is outstanding and actually goes well with the garlic butter or mint jelly if you happen to have them on your plate.Desserts are also stellar, but somewhere between the salad and the main, even the seasoned bon vivant will throw in the towel and beg for mercy before it is offered. Most often, we are served with their (say it again......) HOMEMADE and complimetary birthday cake which is made with real butter cream and oranges or peaches. Even if you are busting at the seams, have a bite of this. It's beyond solid and tastes even better when eaten the next day on an empty stomach.Did I mention you are served with a small cup of sorbet to cleanse the palate between the salad course and main course? Did I mention that the salad and the side dish, as well as the bread, bacon, pickles, cottage cheese, sorbet, and even mint chocolates are all included in the price of a main course? Did I mention that a meal here averages somewhere between 40-60$ per person before wine? This is what makes Gibby's a special place. While certainly not inexpensive, you get spectacular food and value for every dollar spent. I'm genuinely grateful that this place exists and in my humble opinion it continues to define the gold standard for dinner in Montreal.
Our go-to steakhouse in Montreal great steak (Gibbys cut) and lobster! Wish there is one in Toronto!

Gibby's was recommended to us by friends who used to live in Montreal.  The building is beautiful and it had a cozy and festive aesthetic.  It is a bit expensive but you really get an excellent quality and quantity of food.  The wine selection was excellent.  Wish we would have had room for more!

One of the best restaurants I've ever been! I ordered the eggplant parmesan with double baked potato. Simply the best! It's too much food, I could barely finish it. No room for dessert unfortunately. Worth the price x quality of food!

My husband and I had a truly amazing and memorable experience at GIbby's when we were visiting Montreal for our Mini-moon. Our waiter, Sam, was phenomenal. The pickles on the table were an excellent (and delicious) touch, along with the warm bread. The wine here is so inexpensive! They actually charge you for what it costs to have the portion bottle of wine instead of most places charging 12-15 American for a glass. I started with the bisque. My husband had the French onion. Both were amazing. He said it was the best French onion he's ever had. The homemade dressing on the salad was really good. I wish I would have bought some. For our main entrees we both had the beef wellington and the monte carlo potato. I could go on and on about this dish. The beef inside the flaky crust was cooked PERFECTLY. How do they even do that? The potato had so many flavors and melted in my mouth. I currently still have dreams about this meal even months later.For a classy steakhouse, this place isn't exactly cheap but it ended up being less expensive than we expected. Highly recommend.

Old school ambiance in old Montreal. Our server Nancy was nice and helpful. We ordered our dinners... a Gibby's cut ribeye medium and a 8 oz filet medium well. Salads are included with entrees and came out quickly and were delicious. Entrees also came out in a timely manner shortly thereafter. My wife cuts into her filet and it is medium rare at best. She flags down the server to ask if it could get it cooked a bit more. No problem they take it back. The manager, Ani..Anni.. something like that comes back with it after a few minutes and it was not anymore done after he requests we check it and personally sees that it is still quite rare.He apologizes and says he will have a new steak out shortly and we are disappointed, but still ok at this point. He comes back out a few minutes later and says that the steak will be 7 more minutes. Roughly 15 minutes later we tell our server that we do not want the steak anymore as she has lost her appetite but a moment later the peach Ani, puts the steak on the table and my wife tells him she is not even hungry anymore. He huffs and puffs and takes her silverware and food away with him.Our check comes and the steak was removed but there is a $10 charge for her salad. My wife heated at this point approaches the manager and questions the salad charge. He explains it is company policy but rudely replies that he will take off the charge if it makes her feel better. The situation should of been handled differently for a steak house of this caliber and the kitchen and management missed the mark.There is so much potential for this place as my steak was delicious but also underdone. They need to learn how to cook to temperature and how to treat customers/ how to handle objections.

So glad my friends and I came to try this place out! We came from Toronto for my boyfriends birthday and heard so many rave reviews for this place, it didn't disappoint!It's situated along a small cozy street and we had a reservation for 4 at 7:30pm. We were seated quickly however it was busy and the manager who seated us was walking rather fast and it was hard for us to keep up.Once seated our server Milton was great! We all had the Gibby's Salad. It came with freshly cracked black pepper and croutons on the side offered by Milton and the dressing was very tangy. I had the rib eye steak and my boyfriend had the rib steak. We all got the twice baked potato and it was delicious!The steak came out a perfect medium rare and it is HUGE. For a 50$ steak it is really worth it considering the keg back in Toronto can be just as expensive. It comes with a black pepper and garlic sauce on top however I opted to have it on the side. We aren't fans of red wine so we just stuck to drinking Stella that came in bottles.The butter bread and pickles that came with the meal was pretty good considering we didn't eat all day on the bus ride here.

Wow.... What the Keg should be.It feels so warm and cozy inside. Only way that it would feel better, would be at a ski lodge on Christmas, after a day of cross country skiing. The food was phenomenal and great whisky /drinks menu. Steak.... WOW!! Great portions as well.  I most definitely would love to come back if and when I go back to Montreal.

Great food! Nice cosy atmosphere, highly recommend it for business dinner or date nights! （hint, the crowd is more of a "mind your own business type" instead of hype or friendly) but service is excellent! Complimentary parking!!Complimentary bread is excellent, comes with perfect butter, crispy bacon sprinkles, and huge pickles! They are delicious! even my 1 yr old baby loved it! I got lobster tails, amazing value plus perfect taste and cooked just right! It was a huge plate, but perfect for sharing with my kid. The mushroom side is also a must try! Great wine collection! Cocktails looked good too. I'd recommend this place when you are up for some hearty sea food and seeking for a higher end rustic hide away. There was literally no waiting in between plates! Wow! And a big thumb up on the sorbet between starter and main!!

This a beautiful place for a special dinner. We were visiting Montreal for our anniversary and I actually got several people recommending this restaurant. We decided to try it and we weren't disappointed. It is inside a castle! It feels like it inside and out. It's not just for show. We went on a weekday around 7ish and there seemed to be a lot of business people. It was a little loud. It wasn't as romantic as I thought because if that. However, the food was good. They have pickles at the table. I don't know if this is a Canadian thing but I'm not into it. My husband tried them and said they were good. We both got steak and they were perfectly cooked. We got bread and it was fresh. I wish I remembered the name of the dishes. The restaurant is close to a beautiful street nearby that has many vendors and feels very European. I recommend you walk around after.

Oh my goodness where can I start?Well first the atmosphere is indescribable, cozy, romantic and casual all at once. Food was excellent starting from my clam chowder which was the best I've ever had , then a garlic steak the small one is as big as a regular size one ... and our server Jeff was very patient and helpful(excellent) service. Going back before I head back home

I've been to Gibbys countless times and almost never disappointed. We did once have a bad experience with a new waiter, but there is a learning curve, so no big deal. Easily the best steakhouse in Montreal. Everything is always cooked to perfection, sides are included (you see a of places where you have to pay extra for a side of potato, not his place). Everything is homemade, meal starts with fresh warm bread, butter, bacon bits, and pickles. Salad is included, and is delicious, I keep meaning to buy their dressing when I leave but always forget once I'm in the absolute food coma you get from their food. For an average price of $100.00/person with drinks, you can't beat it for a nice night out, especially in the summer, because Vieux Montreal surrounding Gibbys is so nice for a walk afterwards.

Quant, classy, and absolutely delicious. This beautiful restaurant is a classic steakhouse in old Montreal. Our steak dinners were absolutely delicious, I got the Gibby's classic with a double baked potatoe. Our server was pretty uneducated about which wines would pair well with our steaks, as we were novices as well. Though the manager was able to help us out, and capped our evening with class. Definitely looking forward to coming back here!

We live in New York every time we come to Montreal we eat here, you can not go wrong this is one of the best restaurants in the city.  Both the food and the service are on point every single time I've been here at least 50 times and I've never once been disappointed.

I would give Gibbys a solid 5/5! People like to complain that it is expensive but it is a STEAKHOUSE! the food is good, and you get A LOT of bang for your buck! (you are also paying for the experience!!!) I can't imagine anyone leaving Gibbys hungry. Make sure to make a reservation, especially if you are going on a Thursday-Friday-Saturday night. My boyfriend had a steak and I had halibut and everything was absolutely delicious!Our waitress was pretty neurotic but very friendly nonetheless.

This restaurant definitely deserves all the credit it gets. I came here on New Years Eve and it was the perfect place for it. Definitely have to make reservations to assure a spot. I had the beef wellington with a lobster tail and Montecarlo stuffed potato. All I can say was everything was divine. The meats were all cooked and seasoned to perfection. The pastry was buttery and soft and everything felt like it melted in your mouth. Even their appetizers are amazing: from the fresh bread, to juicy pickles, to real bacon bits!Service is beyond excellent and they time all your meals to come out perfectly. The ambiance of the restaurant and classy and rustic and was overrall very welcoming.
It is not a bad place, but it is very expensive for what it actually is. I had a rib steak and I am pretty sure it was not AAA, overpriced.

This is definitely one of our favourite go to when in Montreal.  Situated in old Montreal the restaurant itself is quite dated but the experience leaves you satisfied and definitely willing to come back.  Their service is on point and no matter how busy it is they are there to cater to your needs.We had an endless supply of warm bread and pickles that really made the meal enjoyable and kept the kids busy while we waited for our food.  My husband ordered the Gibby's cut Ribeye and I got the Canadian Lobster tails.  The steak was cooked perfectly and the cut was amazing.  The Canadian Lobster tails were juicy and succulent.  It was seasoned with garlic and butter and was to die for.  Enjoyed the Monte Carlo potato way better than the Kegs version as it was very flavourful.  The best part of the ending a meal there is having dessert.  We ordered the Creme Brûlée and it was perfectly made cold on the inside and the top layer perfectly crispy.  You could literally hear the crack when you dipped in.  By far the best Creme brûlée I have ever had.  Overall, it is a bit on the pricey side but worth the experience and we left feeling very full and happy.

What a great steakhouse! Food was impeccable, fresh, hot, tasty, on point all around. Fresh bread along with pickles and bacon bits came promptly. What a combo, delicious. The NY steak was cooked perfect, nicely seasoned and very flavourful. The service was superior, from the moment we walked in to the amazing, prompt, and courteous staff that served us. Well done, left full and happy with a great dining experience.  This was my first time here and certainly it won't be my last.

This gem located in old Montreal is Oof my favorite steakhouses! Everything from service, food and ambiance is a 5 stars. It's on the pricier side but totally worth it. Your meal begins with yummy warm homemade bread, pickles and delicious butter to go with the warm bread.Then your main dish comes with the option of soup or salad- my pick is the fresh salad. Then to change your palette, a scoop of sorbet is served. For the main course, I usually order rib eye steak, filet mignon or lobster. Each one is heavenly and well spiced. Not to forget the dish comes with your choice of rice or potatoes. My favorite is the monte Carlo potato. I am normally full after indulging so much however if you have some room left, I strongly recommend ordering and sharing the Irish coffee. It really hits the spot and as a bonus you get to see them prepare a whole show in front of you.This place is always packed for a reason so make sure to rsvp. I am pretty confident you will have a wonderful experience and be back! PS: if you are celebrating a special occasion or a birthday, they have complimentary cake which is really delicious! Lastly, they have complimentary valet parking which is wonderful since parking in old Montreal can be a hassle!

Came to this restaurant so many times,it's was kind of dispointed this time. The waiter were forgotten couple dishes that we ordered. Entry that we ordered didn't come main course is served asked a lobster tail on the main course didn't come either. Really enjoy the foods but the service needs to be improved. I'll still coming back anyway for the foods.

Started the meal off with escargot which was to die for. Make sure to great extra bread to dip in that delicious butter. For dinner, I had the Beef Wellington--rare. It was HEAVENLY and cooked a perfect combination of rare to medium-rare. The bordelaise sauce was amazing as well. I had it with the Monte Carlo potato, which is a twice baked potato and freaking amazing!  This restaurant is cozy and a great place to bring friends and colleagues. I can't wait to return.

I am impressed by this steak house, you will leave with a full stomach and a happy wallet. It is reasonably price and the quality is superb.It's an old school fine dining steakhouse. Dim lights and a bit cramped. All male waiters that are professional and provides excellent service.They give a warm loaf of bread with generous portions of butter and bacon and a bowl of huge pickles. We wanted to save our belly's for the steak so we barely put a dent in it, but asked for it to go hehe (excellent for the road trip back)Apps- a little disappointing, nothing specialmarinated onions and tomatoes. exactly what the name suggests. It's refreshing but would never had thought that it would be an appGibby's salad- I was expecting more from the dressing but it tasted like a regular salad to me.They give a scoop of lemon sorbet to cleanse your palette before the main course.Entrees- BEST COURSE EVER, sides are meh but you're here for: Rib eye ( gibby's cut) med rare- huge cut with bone in, got it with butter and garlic and it was cooked perfectly. you can stab your fork in and it wouldn't get stuckBeef wellington med rare- first time ordering a wellington and I am impressed. A tender steak wrapped in a flakey crisp wrap, I can see why Gordon ramsay is all about it. My steak did look a little bit more on the rare side, not sure if that's how it is but it was so tender that I didn't even mind. Better than it being over cooked!Dessert- too full for dessert but they do offer a whole birthday cake (vanilla sponge cake with whip cream and fresh fruit) if you noted that it was for a birthday/special occasion when making reservations. They even take a photo for you and print it out as a memory gift! not a lot of places do this still. Such a nice gesture.You got to try this place!

This steak house takes you back to the old ages. From the entrance, to the dinning hall and the waiter/waitress it was like steeping into the 80's haha. The food was good, service was prompt but the price was little hefty. We went to celebrate life so I didn't mind paying extra. Very nice place for a special night out and if you don't mind paying a little extra for the service, which is worth it. They take a picture of you and bring it in a little Gibbys postcard in less than 10mins if you're having a special night, I think that's a great customer service. I will be back when my wallet is full ... lol

This place rules. Bread, pickles and bacon bits as a free starter, all my favorite apps and all my favorite entrees.  Beef Wellington, Rack or Lamb, ribeyes, they have it all.The atmosphere is great and the building is beautiful. I went ~10 years ago and am planning on going again on Labor Day when we make the trek once again from Boston to Montreal.

May have been my favorite spot this trip. Cool ambiance inside an old building with the old wood beams, old chairs, and fireplaces going. They brought fresh bread, butter, bacon bits, and pickles to start with.  I ordered the Gibbys rib cut steak (good) with Monte Carlo twice baked potato (one of the best potatoes I have had), house salad with house dressing (good), and finished with their house special Gibbys Chocolate Delight(very good).  Service was friendly and quick.  I recommend giving the place a try.

We chose to have dinner here due to it's already high ratings and even though the prices are high, I think every cent is worth it. The quality was very good, but more than that the service was amazing. I can say it was the best foodie experience I had so far and made my visit to montreal extremely memorable. We tried the french onion soup. It had so much cheese that we couldn't even finish it. After that they surprised us with a cute lemon sorbet to  freshen up our palates.I tried the fillet mignon Wellington. I wanted to share with my mom so they provided an extra baked potato on a plate, free of charge. It also came with a tasty ceasar salad.Finally, with the bill they bring the most amazing thin mint flavoured dark chocolate pieces. Such a wonderful finish.If you want to treat yourself, this is the place to go.

Best steak I've had in Canada. Fantastic service and a vodka martini that is made to perfection It's my second time there and the experience was that same outstanding quality. Looking forward to my third when I return to Montreal. I had the Ribeye with rice pilaf.

Excellent meal all around and perfect service. The French onion soup was excellent and the table pickles and bacon were very fun and new to us. The bread was awesome and the food was great. We really enjoyed it very much.Only 4 stars because one of our steaks was overcooked, but they made it up to us by comping a dessert which was very nice of them.
One of my fav in town! Friendly atomosphere and.welxoming staff, food is always dilicious!highly recommended

Prior to coming, I read reviews about this place but I was very disappointed leaving here. First, we made a reservation for 2 couples to not be seated with each other and they ended up seating us with each other. Pros:- Decor: I loved the entry to the restaurant. Very cute to take pictures of with your friends or significant other. It has a very rustic vibe to the restaurant. Cons: - Food: Our clam chowder was not very good. The clams were not fresh and had a different taste to them. We also got the Filet Mignon of Beef Wellington and the beef did not taste so great either. My partner got the Lobster Tails and they did also not taste fresh. - Price: For the quality of food I got and the weight of the price, my partner and I were not to happy. - Parking: You will probably have to pay for valet here. Unless you leave early and can find parking in the area. Unfortunately, we are from Toronto and did not know the area well. Overall, I do not think I will be coming back. As nice as the restaurant is, I was fairly disappointed with the quality of food we, had for the price we paid.

I came here on Wednesday evening to have dinner at the recommendation of my hotel concierge. The restaurant itself is located in an old stable, so it's a really interesting venue. The restaurant is also located in old Montreal, a historic part of town with some really interesting architecture and old buildings. The service itself is quite nice, attentive, and responsive.I ordered the ribeye, or what they referred to as the Gibbys cut, which was a standard 22oz steak. Being in Montreal, I wanted to try a steak with true Montreal seasoning, and it actually was much less salty than Montreal seasoning rub you would buy in a store, which I liked as most places tend to over salt their meat.  One thing to note is that their medium rare It's probably a little bit more rare than you would typically expect. Also, they only season one side of the meat which was a surprise to me. The cut of meat wasn't spectacular for a ribeye steak... it also didn't taste that spectacular. The asparagus that came with the steak was also not seasoned at all and tasted like it was simply blanched.  The salad had a dressing mixed in which I asked for to be on the side but the salads were premade so the only thing the waitress could do was request a light dressing -- it was tasty but still a bit too heavy on the dressing for my taste.  The Monte Carlo potato is basically one where they scoop out the potato, mash it and add bacon bits, chives, etc, and stuff it back into the potato.  Menu price ~$54.  The ambience is nice, and you don't have to cook it yourself, but an average tasting ribeye, blanched asparagus, a salad, and a baked potato for that price just felt a bit too high

One of the best places in Montreal for steak and seafood.Quite and elaborate menu that you can't go wrong with.Escargot, salmon and beef Wellington were good choices.A great wine selection that goes well with the food.Don't miss out and treat yourself to fine cuisine !

Warm bread and picklesGazpachoA hint of spice. DelightfulOnion/spice after taste but not too strong.Lemon sorbet (palate cleanser)Worked really well because my mouth had a lot of aftertaste of onion left.Monte CarloThis came with our main. It was really good! And it came on a medium/large sized potato.Rib Steak (Gibbys cut)To be honest, I was kind of disappointed by the steak. There was too much gristle and the steak was rare, not medium rare.But the other experience superseded the disappointment (even though I was looking very much forward to the steak). The sauce that came with it went really well with the steak though.Side note: The portions here are huge and the cost performance is great. It might've just my cut that was bad.Side dish of lobster tailThey tasted really good. Especially when you dip it in the garlic butter that comes with it.My friends got the Beef Wellington, Salmon, and Mignons of Beef Diane, and they loved it! I've tasted them and they were better than my steak.Service was on point. Our waiter was Sebastien. He filled our water very regularly, and he was very helpful with food/drink suggestions.Overall, I would definitely come back again. :)
Great food and great service. Had Christmas dinner here. Everything we tried was well prepared and delicious. The beef wellington and snail starter were standout dishes.

This iconic restaurant in the old port is a must when visiting Montreal. Opened two years after the first Gibby's (1972) in St Sauveur (1970) this place will definitely win you over if you're looking for a steakhouse.I've only been here once many years ago and remembered having a really fun evening. This time around was to celebrate my mom's birthday. We were a group of 16. Some came late, other had way too many questions and demands. You know, the annoying ones ;). The waitresses were more then nice and patient. No complaints about the service here. Everything was great!The wine list was ok. It has too many American wines and certainly not enough wines from France (they only had red Bordeaux). Menu is pretty straight forward and there is no extra fee for sharing the plates! Now THAT i love!!! Our meats were cooked to perfection. The only thing that i didn't like was the watery/wilted salad. I think they dressed it too early. Portions are huge! Free pickles! Free bread and free real bacon bits. I don't think i could afford eating here every week but can certainly come back when craving a great steak!

For the price, you can do much better in Montreal.  The place is stuffy, especially in the basement, the service is very inattentive, clueless at times and the waiter had little manners (Sniffles?  Blowing your nose?  Come on!).  You do get the feeling you're in a steak factory.The prices are absolutely scandalous.  Expect to pay SAQx3 from the wine card.  The food itself is very good but you can get a comparable meal elsewhere.  We had the filet mignon and it was delicious.  The monte-carlo potato was top notch.After dropping north of $230 for two, I will definitely never go back.

We went here last night and everything was delicious. The atmosphere is fantastic. Our waiter was polite and on top of everything and helpful. We started with the shrimp cocktail, the shrimp were huge and delicious!  Our son ordered the petite filet with the Monte Carlo potato he was over the moon with the food and highly recommends the potato. My husband got the larger filet with the rice he was also impressed although he did not rave about the rice as much he loved the filet. I got Arctic char fish which was delicious. We finished the night with the Irish coffees a must here. They make a whole production out of this with the sugar glass. Spectacular!! For desert we got the chocolate mousse which unfortunately we could not eat very much of. As other people have stated this is definitely on par with other high end steak places.

Just an overall bad experience. We were originally seated in a small corner on top of the fireplace which was too hot, and next to a serving buffet where the server would open the cabinet into my chair again and again. So we asked the maitre d to be moved...he seemed very put out and moved us to a worse table...never did he smile or act like he liked his job. All of the tables were crammed in together quite like a can of sardines. The server was pleasant, but certainly did not serve us with a smile. The food was pretty average and the decor was ugly and old. I get that it is an old-fashion steakhouse, but you can still maintain your furniture, doors and the downstairs bathrooms and coat area without a huge cost. We would not go back!

Gibbys is a sentimental favourite for me.  As a student, we celebrated graduations and birthdays here, and my husband brought me here the night he proposed.  We hadn't been back in about 10 years, so we were overdue for a return visit.  We brought my parents and my 14 year old daughter.  The decor is exactly the same, rustic and charming but slightly frayed around the edges.  Service is a delight, attentive and professional.  Steaks were very good.  They are on the pricey side, but the thing I like about Gibbys is that they include starter and sides with their steaks.  I have a real gripe with steak houses that charge you $60 for a steak and can't throw a potato and a few greens on your plate for free.  My mom had the salmon and said it was excellent.  It was a huge serving and enough for lunch the next day.  Mom and dad both enjoyed Irish coffees after the meal, expensive at $16 each, but prepared table side with a flourish, so worth a splurge.  The one disappointment of the night was my daughter's profiteroles, the pastry was stale and they went largely uneaten.  It's comforting to have a few places that never change... stay classy, Gibbys.

I went to Gibbys on a Thursday night. This was my first time there, I had read great reviews about the place and with the price I was expecting amazing steak. Unfortunately, i was slightly disappointed. Honestly, almost everything was great. Nice ambiance, free valet, staff was attentive and outstanding  with there service. They start you off with in house bread (very tasty) pickles. When you order a main plate, salad and potatoes come with it. Salad was very good, nice light dressing, Monte Carlo baked potato was out of this world. The ribeye was very delicious however my beef wellington was not that great. I was watching master chef and Gordon Ramsey was showing how to make beef wellington and it looked so good. So I searched Montreal restaurants and found that Gibbys had this item on their menu. But I was let down, first I had asked for Medium cook but the brought Medium rare. I asked them to cook it more. Once they brought it back, the meat was not seasoned at all and was kinda tough. I did not enjoyed it at all.I am still giving it a 4 star as everything else was excellent. But I do not recommend the beef wellington
It's the best steak house in Canada Montreal everything was so good, the service was great, we were 11 rolled everything was perfect.

This place is great old style steak house in Old Montreal. When you walk in the smell of steak fills the air. Great cuts of beef. Three of us got the  Gibby cut (frenched ribeye) cooked perfectly and seasoned nicely. Had a great shrimp cocktail and French onion soup. Its not a cheep chain so dinner is going to cost you but it's worth it.

Gibbys was recommended to us by others who have eaten here on their trips to Montréal. Gibbys is located in the beautiful, rustic neighborhood of "Old Montréal." As soon as you walk in you feel like you're in a different era, a colonial era. Even the servers wear uniforms that remind you of simpler times.Gibbys is open for dinner service and it's highly recommended you make a reservation. We were the first guests in the building for our reservation, but not even an hour later almost all the dining rooms were full and they were on a decent wait. There is a nice, large waiting area upstairs where there are many couches, seats, etc. The restrooms are also located by the waiting area upstairs and to my surprise it was a gorgeous, clean restroom (strange observation, I know, but too many places these days don't take care of their facilities).Dinner service starts with bread, homemade pickles and fresh bacon bits. I didn't know what to do so I just ate the pickles and scooped some bacon bits in with the mixture. Their pickles are DELICIOUS. They are giant, whole pickles with lots of flavor and crunch. I started with the French Onion soup and wasn't impressed. Soup was very sweet and didn't have a whole lot of flavor. I'm more of a salty French Onion person, but that's just me.For dinner I had the escargot. Escargot was delicious, but I was surprised it didn't come with toast or bread of some sort to dip in the oil. My Mom enjoyed her salmon and said it was perfect. It did look great and the vegetables accompanying the dish were just the right "al dente" style so I would say salmon there is a safe choice if you're looking for a fish dish. My fiancé had the filet and loved it as well. It was cooked to the temperature of his liking. I guess for the money I would expect presentation to be more than it was. None of the dishes had that "WOW" look to them. Taste is always more important than presentation, but sometimes presentation can deceive the mind into thinking the food tastes better, or vice versa.I do want to note that the service was SPECTACULAR and we made sure our server knew it. She made our experience memorable. We were here celebrating my fiancé's birthday and she came out with a birthday cake (not sure if it was complimentary as I did not see the receipt) that said "Happy Birthday Ryan!" and was enough to feed 6-8 people, if not more. The cake was light and not too rich, with some lovely fruit in the mixture. We all loved it. They also take your picture and then at the end of the meal come out with a Gibbys paper frame with the picture inside! It's such a unique touch and we greatly appreciated the gifts. Everyone from our server to the hosts to the reservationist and management were extremely friendly and welcoming.I would say this place is so popular because of the nostalgia feel it gives the folks of Montréal who have been dining here since they were children. The food was just OK to me. I'm glad I tried it, but don't know if I would go back.

I can't believe I am rating Ginny's a 2 star!  I have been many times to Gibbys and it is my go to place for showing clients and relatives from out of town - a great Montreal restaurant - Gibbys was always a fine dining experience and was proud to show it off.  I took 6 international guests last night for steaks.  The service was very slow, not much attention even though the restaurant was only 1/3 full.  The steaks were over done - I had the petit filet - medium - and it was kite medium well and dry.  The plate with the potato looked bare and very Industriel like - nothing special, just an ordinary steak with a potato thrown on.   Seems like they are taking the great Gibbys name for granted and don't care about living up to its history.
Rly rly rly rly rly rly rly good! Very cozy atmosphere. The food and service was incredible.

FOODIES: do NOT go here!!!!!! You will hate it!!This place is the type of place my parents would enjoy.  It's dark, dingy, the server outfits are outdated, and the food is over priced.  Yet, this is a well known restaurant in Montreal so it keeps packing in the people.Being from Texas, I know good steak, this is not good steak.  I've had better steak in Denmark.  Having traveled the world, it is rare to take a recommendation from a trusted source without first consulting Yelp but I didn't have Wifi so I went with the suggestion and now I wish I hadn't.There is not a full service bar to eat at so if you're a single person, you will be seated at a table.  My waiter was Asian.  Nothing against him at all but from the start, you knew this was not going to be an authentic meal at all.They bring you bread, butter, pickles and bacon pieces.  That's strange but I went with it.  All were pretty alright.The wine selection is unimpressive to say the least.  I ordered Osso Bucco because I heard from the table next to me that the steaks were over cooked.  And I saw that the table next to me was served a well done steak.  Again, being from Texas, the cook should know better than to butcher a good cut of meat.The Osso Bucco was a large portion and the flavor was not memorable.  As my side, I had a baked potato Monte Carlo which I was grateful for as it was the only food item I could really eat and it was not great.  On the side I was served carrots and asparagus, they were not prepared with any uniqueness at all.  They do provide you with lemon sorbet to cleanse your pallet and that tasted good, ha!  Oh, they do give you tiny chocolate square when you pay that are edible.I don't know why people dine here, I can get better food at Texas Roadhouse.  I guess it's nostalgia?? I looked around the dining room and there were both young & old people so I'm guessing it's their reputation or name that keeps them in business.  I wouldn't dine there again.

Bad seating. Restaurant is empty and they give you a hard time over seating. We almost left and should have. The food was Lousy. Below average and way over priced. Slowww service. Bad attitude. Way over rated restaurant! Eat there and you will see.

This was our favorite restaurant in the old city. Linda, our waitress, was great. She gave us suggestions - had the Filet Mignon and Lobster. The bread was delicious. Large selection of wines. We didn't have a reservation, would suggest having one to ensure you get in.

Gibby's has been our go to restaurant for over 30 years for birthdays and when we craved  a great steak.  Last nights dinner was less than average, it was actually very disappointing.  We were 6 people out for my and my mother in laws birthday.  Ambience was good as usual but from the get go the service was off.  The waiter was very nice and polite but something was wrong.  He did not have that usual Gibby's warm sincere welcome.  The usual bread and pickles seemed good although I personally didn't try them.  The salads came after ordering and were full bowls but mostly lettuce hardly any tomato.  Then there was a long wait till the main dishes came and restaurant at that time was about 60% full.  The main dishes were, rib steak, crusted steak was very average, Arctic char shared with my wife--was very below average, in taste and presentation, osso bucco was ok but quite stringy, and an onion soup, that was left half eaten.  Our side dishes --mushrooms and baked potatoes arrived 15 minutes later --by then our food was cold.  The steamed vegetables were very good and were the best part of the meal.  For dessert they brought a personalized cake--very disappointing looked like it came out of my 8 year old nieces easy bake oven.  The coffees then arrived about 15 minutes after the cake.Over all it was not the Gibby's I am used to.  I wonder if Mgmt has changed siince Gibby's pasSed away.  But the overall experience seemed to  reflect a change in management.I don't think we will be going Back anytime  soon.

The old city setting is charming and I wish we were able to sit on the lovely terrace but it is hard to get a reservation here. The food was delicious and satisfying - our favorite was the Monte Carlo potatoe], which is essentially a twice baked potato. The house salad that came with our steak could have used more flavorful tomatoes. The reason I am giving only four stars is because this is a steakhouse and our steaks, while tasty, were tough and chewy. We got the Gibby's cut of ribeye. At any price but especially these high prices, you don't want to go wrong with your signature dish.

Gibbys is awesome!  Was recommended this place by our horse carriage driver.  My partner and I totally enjoyed the atmosphere, the drinks and, especially, the food.   The service was amazing from beginning to end and extra personalized with the waitress and host knowing my name throughout. Tried Escargot for the first time and wasnt disappointed. Cant wait to visit again.

Just been to Gibby's for only my second time. I had the Rid Eye Steak. It was absolutely beautiful. Perfect cut of meat cooked to perfection. Absolutely huge meal. Excellent value and again brilliant professional service.  100% recommend.

Super nice restaurant, great service (our waitress was so sweet and great to talk to) the food, omg it was like heaven. I was with my family and they all agreed the food was super good:))) definitely recommend.

I was really excited to go to Gibby's...let me start by saying there is valet service which is amazing when u live in Mtl because its cold! And the valet is very kind and polite, as well as the rest of the staff.  Very attentive, beautiful atmosphere the restaurant is just well run.  I ordered the filet mignon which was huge and absolutely delicious.  The bread and pickles were good as well, however the salad was a big disappointment for me.  I had what appeared to be a bag of iceberg lettuce mix drowning in some Italian dressing, and some fresh baby spinach sprinkled on top.  I think that could be improved, but overall dinner service was excellent I totally recommend.
Awesome and more awesome.  Great spit for romance or business meetings.   Can't beat the Service and food.   Can't wait for the next time.

Gibbys is as great a steak house as they come. Located in the heart of the old port you get an amazing feel of the older part of town. If arriving by car you are greeted by valet who handles the hassle of locating parking in this area. The main entrance is beautiful courtyard and a rustic wooden door. Wherever you are seated you'll get this great warm feeling as the atmosphere of the restaurant sucks you in. My go to order is the fillet mignon with Dianne sauce. I have never been disappointed by this cut and always have it cooked just right. For dessert a flambé coffee is the way to go. If you still have room you can grab any dessert or simply munch on a mint chocolate in the shape of the iconic gibbys door. Worth the splurge every time !

This steakhouse was exceptional, but had a few flaws. The service was not very good, and we had to wait 15 minutes in the beginning. But then service was better. The salad was probably the best part of the night, as the dressing was flavorful and overall amazing. The food was good, I had ordered a filet mignon, which lacked in  flavor. Was also let down by the cream spinach, as it didn't even taste like cream spinach. Last we had dessert. We ordered a crepe and cheesecake. The cheesecake was not even cooked, and the crepe was overall not very good. At the very end, the had minty chocolates that are complementary with the bill. Was let down by the overall 4.5 review this restaurant had.

tired location, needs a really good cleaning......used to be reasonable, but everything is laced with salt and garlic so one questions the quality of everything......if you have to enhance and cover it up.........no thank you

Well it's been a few years Gibby. My palate has matured while yours has not. Unfortunately my wife and I were marooned to a back room among boisterous business bores. The salad was good but the Wellington was not. The pastry had an agenda quite separate from the rest of the dish. The duxelles was more of a mushroom sauce. The filet was undercooked. The service was friendly and efficient. The price was high for such mediocre food. The building itself is attractive but overall the experience was not a good one. I will no longer recommend this place and we won't be back.
If you're going to splurge, this place is worth it! Great service, great food! Beef Wellington and steaks were great, but I'd skip the dessert.
The portions here are huge. So much food at a fair price. Delicious steaks. Came here for a bachelor party and did a pre fixed menu and it was amazing. Extremely accommodating.

Avoid this restaurant.  We arrived for an 8:30 reservation.  They weren't ready so the host asked us to wait in the lounge.   We sat in the lounge and ordered drinks. Then a host came in before we received the drinks and said they were ready.  The bartender canceled the drinks.  We looked up and the host was gone.  We went to the host desk.   No host.  5 minutes later the guy comes back.   And takes to the basement room.   We felt like we were being punished.  I paid $45 for a filet mignon that was chewy and not very flavorful.  My girlfriend got halibut that was like flavorless gelatin    When the waiter saw we were unhappy they offered comped desert.   We got creme brûlée    It tasted and had the consistency of vanilla mayonnaise  and the top was burnt charcoal black.   Yep.... $245.   Horrible.
Brought family from New York to enjoy the Gibbys Experience and was not disappointed. The service was top notch and our waitress Esperanza was fantastic. Highly recommend

Excellent food excellent service great atmosphere Escargot was delicious... waiter was a pro. A little loud so barely acceptable for a romantic dinner, I asked for a window table for my engagement dinner, just me and my fiancé and we got a table for two in between two windows sitting on a wall, thought that was funny..

Excellent sirloin! Had a really good experience here! The steak came with a big twice baked potato and a decent size salad. This is definitely one of the best steaks I've ever had and certainly the best meal I had while visiting Montreal. The atmosphere is dark and appropriately cozy feeling. But not crowded or loud. I thought our service was really good too. Not in your face and not absent either. I would go back for sure.

I was torn between rating Gibby's a 4 or a 5, but Shannon, our server, deserves it to be a 5.  Before I go into any other detail, I need to make sure you all know  the service is hands down some of the best we have had. Drinks were never close to being empty throughout our 2 hour meal.The food is phenomenal--from the appetizers to the meals. We had the shrimp cocktail, French onion soup, Gibby's salads (yum! Where can I get that dressing in the US), a Gibby's cut ribeye and a petite filet Mignon. Both steaks were cooked perfectly. I was jealous of my husband's steak because he got the garlic butter/herbs on his, but mine was fabulous, too. The Monte Carlo potatoes are also delicious! I wish we had room for dessert--the apple crisp that was going by looked to die for.The only downfall to our dinner was that we were seated in the basement area, and it was extremely loud. I know Gibby's is located in a city, and I know the majority of loud parties were Americans (like myself) enjoying a night out in Montreal, so I can overlook the small let down. Just be forewarned if you're looking for a romantic dinner, this may not be the ideal place to go on a Saturday night.

My friends and I came to Montreal to celebrate a friends birthday. We decided to try out Gibbys after reading all the reviews. We are so glad we went. To begin, this place is so nice and comforting inside. You feel like you're in a cottage with how the holiday decor looked. All the waiters and waitresses were beyond nice and helpful. We started off with a bunch of appetizers: the jalapeño sausage, mushroom tart, and French onion soup. Loved all of it! I'm not the biggest fan of mushrooms, but the tart was very tasty. The French onion soup was delicious with all that gooey cheese. The sausage came with mango chutney which paired well with it due to the sweet and spicy. At the table itself, they serve pickles, bread/butter, and a bowl of bacon bites. We were all in love. We each ordered our individual entrees (which the lady told us when ordering appetizers it's a lot of food, but we didn't care). My petite filet was good, however a little undercooked from what i had asked. Right away the waitress took it back and within minutes brought me a new plate with new sides. I was beyond shocked because usually i would just get the steak back. The Monte Carlo baked potato was really good with sour cream, bacon and chives. The asparagus was okay, a little too thick. For dessert we ordered a cake for my friend, which you can tell was homemade. The cake itself was very light and fluffy and the cream was a fresh buttercream. Others at table ordered the tableside Irish coffee which was a wonderful show to end our evening and it tasted so good. Once we were done (we were one of the last groups in the restaurant, we asked if they can take a picture which they did and even helped us "stage" the picture by picking a nice backdrop and moving the tables/chairs. Hands down one of the best steakhouses I've been.

The charm of this place is just like no other steak house I've been to. Staff was amazing and even brought out a birthday cake for my husband birthday at the end of the night. This is definitely a 5 course meal as food just keeps coming out. Pickles to break, soup, salads and  your meal all in 1 sitting. Every course was fresh and perfectly done by the chef. You can tell the cooking staff takes its time to make sure the food is done right and presented perfectly. This place is a must go to if you like steak houses. Thanks Gibbys for an amazing night!
Amazing food and so much for what we paid. There loaded baked potato was the best ive ever had and the service was amazing

I was convinced by the waiter to get the Arctic Char instead of the Salmon.  This morning, I've just thrown most of it back into the ocean.The service was actually very nice.  The couple next to us was celebrating an anniversary and they gave them a free cake!The waiter offered to take the fish back when he realized I didn't like it.  I decided to keep it because I know it is a healthy fish, and because I didn't want to hold up my husband's meal, and I didn't want to wait myself for a whole new meal.  I didn't realize I'd still be repeating it this morning.
Food was great! Met a gentleman from Egypt  who works as a hostess  was so lovely . Food was ok.

I took this recommendation from a local patron at La Casa de Habano, and glad I did. The huge stone building appears to have been a stable, or at least it has a courtyard for carriages.Try the Beef Wellington. It is excellent, tender and the mushroom sauce is the bomb. It's enough for two if you are having salad and dessert. Get a reservation. This place stays busy all the time. It's a Montreal favorite for dinner and celebrations!

Helpful, well informed staff, nice selection of Portuguese wine, and fabulous food. Well worth the Uber ride. Go early, we had the majority of the staff to chat about their favs which gave us a glimpse of the best pics. Thanks for a great dinner, charming venue, and an easy 5 star review

Came here to celebrate my birthday. It was recommended by our tour guide so we thought to check it out. It's located in old Montreal. We drove to the restaurant and good thing they had valet because it was hard to find street parking. We made reservations on a Wednesday night. The restaurant is huge! 2 floors. Brick walls, dark lighting. It was pretty loud in the place with it being so big. We ordered steak and the osso bucco. The steak was cooked perfect at medium rare. Delicious. We chose to have the salad which was average. They give you bread and bacon bits. In between your meal they give you lemon sorbet to cleanse your pallet. Pretty awesome.  Now the best thing was that if it is your birthday, they make you an entire cake for free! And then they take a picture of you, print it out, and place it in a Gibbys photo holder. Pretty awesome service for freeing you ask me! Service was so fast and efficient. Definitely recommend the place!

Enjoyed a lovely evening with great friends over a tasty grilled & sizzled to perfection rib eye steak with unlimited bread and pickles, a delicious salad, a Monte Carlo Potato at Gibbys Restaurant (My Top 5 must eat resto) in #Montreal.

Gibbys is an old time classic steak house that is definitely one of the best in downtown Montreal and in my mind could be the best consistent restaurant in the old port.  You enter this place and it has a rustic charm feel to it that is both warm and cozy. Like being in an old lodge or tavern. Word has it that is used to be the stables for the horses way way back! Onto the menu. There are so many different cuts of beef that even the most difficult curmudgeon will find something to his or her liking. They excel with their peppercorn or mustard sauces on steak. Also there is an excellent selection of fish (salmon, tuna, swordfish, Arctic char) just to name a few. Shrimp and lobster of course. Really a super duper menu!
