On this fine evening I had selected the curry shrimp. I know this is a steakhouse but eating a big morsel of steak at 8:00 pm = a bad nights sleep for me! The curry shrimp came out on a very generous serving on rice with pampadams and asparagus. I found the curry sauce a bit gooey but it had a decent spice and was flavourful and fragrant. One the less! Portion size here is "unbuckle the pants" a bit big! We had 18 people in our group and it was one of the best group dinners we've had together! Everyone had a blast!

Very well run establishment. Excellent service and seriously decent dishes. I had escargot for an appetizer- beautifully executed, tender, and flavorful. My main was the strip which was made perfectly to order and I tried my companion's lamb which blew me away.Very nice policy of charging wines by the glass proportionately, Slightly higher priced than expected, otherwise I'd give them a 5, but overall I highly recommend this restaurant.

Loved it! Went for annniversary dinner with friends on a trip to Montreal. Our steaks were cooked to perfection unlike some of the other reviews have said. Medium rare & delicious. The atmosphere is not upscale but it is very Old Montreal. Our waitress, Linda, was an absolute delight who guided us to moderately pricd wine rather tha nudging us toward a more expensive one. Even my vegetarian husband was satisfied with his eggplant dish. Not cheap but hey, it's Montreal!

This place was amazing! Boy do you get what you pay for! The steak was delicious. The wait staff were out of this world. Service was incredible. If you got a spare chunk of change in your pocket this will be well spent at this place.

Recommend for steak lovers! It's my 2nd time here, the rib steak Gibbys cut is at high quality. Portion is huge, don't think you would have room for desert or appetizer. Had the onion soup last time not as outstanding. Lobster tail is good tho!

Gibby's should definitely be on your list if you're a meat lover. And if you're looking for a full-blown meat experience, you won't leave disappointed, as the menu offers a wide range of steaks, cuts, and even more finest dishes such as fish, chicken, seafood, etc.Gibby's is stacked in a 200-year-old building, which gives to the restaurant all its charm and ambiance. Magnificent and stunning. I had nature oysters as the appetizer. They were absolutely delectable. These were followed by the Gibby's salad and the Petite filet mignon, very rare AKA blue. One word to remember here : tender. To top it off, I added to the whole experience the Gibby's layered chocolate cake. Dinner couldn't have been better without it. Simply delicious and special. Only thing that could be improved is their wine list. Since I'm a wine lover, I love to pair good and funky wine to my delicious dish. Sad that their "exhaustive wine list" isn't that exhaustive. I wish they could add more private importation bottles and also by the glass.Service was lovely, professional and fast. The waitress gave me nice recommendations.

I'd say three stars overall, two if you give much weight to the price. On the plus side, it's in a beautiful building and has a great vibe, and the valet parking is a life-saver for anyone (like us) dumb enough to drive into this neighborhood thinking they'll save time. On the minus side, the food ranges from decent, neighborhood restaurant-quality (the steaks and fish) to standard diner-level (the salad and appetizers), to supermarket-level (the bread).  We were treated to some surreal comedy by a deadpan waitress determined to hard-sell the salad:"Are you sure you want the gazpacho? We're famous for our salad.""That sounds nice, but I'm really in the mood for some gazpacho.""We're FAMOUS for our salad.""Yeah, I don't know ...""And our dressing. You've never had anything like it. We're FAMOUS for our SALAD."So almost everyone ordered the salad, which turned out to be a big bowl of iceberg lettuce, big wedges of half-flavorful tomatoes, and what tasted an awful lot like Newman's Own Italian dressing. It felt a bit like a Seinfeld episode. I was the only one at our table who took a chance on the gazpacho, which, while better than the salad, didn't distinguish itself in any way. It was under-seasoned (it hit the spot after an addition of pepper and the bacon bits they give you to tart up the bread)The arctic char I had was competently cooked, on the conservative / flaky end of the spectrum, and well seasoned. The ribeye steak I sampled was good quality and perfectly cooked medium-rare, with very little temperature gradient. It didn't taste like it had been dry aged or that it was any special provenance. It would have been an impressive steak at a lower price, but I hope for a little more when the price goes north of $50. We had a great time here, but I doubt I'll go back on future Montreal trips. I suspect the city has much better offerings. Gibby's reminds me of many New York City restaurants that have been around forever, and are now mostly famous for being famous. As such they mostly attract tourists (like us) who haven't done enough research.

A famous restaurant in old Montreal which I have been many many times. Its become a tradition in our family that we come here on birthdays so today was my daughters turn. I must say that normally service here is just OK but tonight it was excellent and made a point on my way out telling management about it.I had Gibby's cut Rib eye steak. With an onion soup to start. Both excellent. Although I found that the steak was a little tough it was still good.I found that it was a nice added touch they gave a free bday cake and took a picture and gave it to us in a nice Gibby's card. Classy!!!!We will continue to go back.....

Been here twice now. Once for a bachelor party and once with my wife and another couple. The food here awesome. Got the Gibby's cut steak. Massive steak. Cooked perfectly. The Monte Carlo potato was awesome. The service here really makes this place stand out in my mind though.The first time I was there our server overheard us talking about it being a bachelor party and without warning brought us a congrats cake on the house. Amazing. Second time our server was also very attentive. It's like he knew what we wanted before we did.Great place overall. Good price for what you get. Some of the best service I've ever had.

FOODIES: DO go here!!!!!! You will love it!!This place is the type of place my parents would enjoy.  It's dark, rustic, the server outfits are traditional, and the food is nicely priced, unless you are from Texas. So naturally, this is a well known restaurant in Montreal so it keeps packing in the people.Being from the less racist part of Texas, I know good steak, this is good steak.  I've not had better steak in Denmark.  Having traveled the world, and trekked with gorillas, it is rare to take a recommendation from a trusted source without first consulting Yelp but I didn't have Wifi so I went with the suggestion and now I'm thrilled I did. Just kidding, I don't give Yelp that much credit because come on it's Yelp.There is not a full service bar to eat at so if you're a single person, you will be seated at a table.  But fortunately I'm not single, so we got a nice table. My waiter was Asian. Nothing against him at all but from the start, I knew his race would not affect the authenticity of the meal at all.They bring you bread, butter, pickles and bacon pieces.  That's strange but I went with it.  All were pretty alright.We got the 20oz rib steak Gibby's cup with herbs and spices medium rare. It was near perfect. Not he best steak ever but it hit the spot. We were able to share and had leftovers. Also got lobster tail, mushroom tart, and they came with generous portions of sides. All were delicious.We also got some wine and cognac. Generous pours. Need I say more? Oh, excellent service.I now know why people dine here, I can't get better food at Texas Roadhouse. That's not surprising. I looked around the dining room and there were both young & old people so I'm guessing it's their reputation or name that keeps them in business.  I would dine there again and highly recommend.

What an unforgettable experience!!! Their service and food were outstanding. We came here to celebrate my husbands bday while on our first visit to Montreal.  And I'm so happy that we chose Gibbys. I would like to start this review with a huge Thank You to our server Tammy! She was so great, attentive and had such wonderful energy. We ordered fillet and lobster with a side of baked potato.  The portions are massive. Their salad was delicious. Bread was sooo good. Little things like after the salad, gelato was served to clean your pallet. Warm water with fresh lemons was served to rinse our hands after lobster.....  blew my mind. Nothing really surprises me much and very rare a particular restaurant exceeds my expectations. This one did. When Tammy found out it was my Husbands birthday, they brought out a small cake with candles!!!!! Not a piece of cake but a small entire cake.  Insane! Their dark chocolates made on premises ... Delicious!!!! Apparently all is made on premises. She then came out with a camera to take a pic of us. I'm thinking they'll post this on the restaurants site or something. Nope. She came out with 2 printed pictures each packed in Gibbys paper card. Basically, their attention to detail is nothing like I have ever seen. And we as a group dined in some amazing restaurants in NY and DC. Again, Thrilled with our experience and will recommend this place to anyone who makes it out to Montreal.

It's a birthday occasion for our gathering and I have to say that everything we ordered was better than expected.Not only the food is fantastic, the ambient and service were one of the best we have ever experienced.Will highly recommend to all our friends and family~Will definitely come back to explore more dishes on their menu~

Service and food were fantastic. We arrived 30 minutes early for our reservation, expecting to sit and have a drink first, but we were seated immediately. All of the wait staff was friendly and helpful, making recommendations when asked. I had the petit filet mignon with the baked potato, and my boyfriend had the Gibby's cut rib steak with the Montecarlo potatoes- both were cooked exactly as ordered, and were delicious. We will definitely be back next time we are in Montreal!

Gibby's deserves all the five-star ratings it gets on Yelp. It really is the perfect place for any special occasion. I went to Gibby's a couple months back to celebrate my birthday. Although it's a little more upscale, the staff is still welcoming and friendly. It's nice to be in a place where it seems like most guests are enjoying a special night out. 1. Bread & pickles - The bread is amazingly soft and warm. The pickles are little too salty and (dare I say) I might prefer the ones at Moishe's. 2. Oysters - Deliiiicious. Very fresh and a fresh start to a steak dinner. *Citrus sorbet as palette cleanser3. Filet mignon with baked potato - Very tender and meaty. Cooked to our expectation 4. Beef wellington with Monte Carlo potato - The pastry was flaky and the beef was extraordinarily tender. Really nice mushroom sauce. The potato was so creamy and satisfying. Ended up taking half of the portion home and it still tasted delicious the next day. No room for dessert but will have to go back another time!
Unfortunately, I found this place overpriced for the quality of the food I had. There are better steak places that aren't tourist traps!

OMG... The lamb... the lamb... the lamb... Shared a large sirloin steak and took a chance on the lamb... holy sweet Jesus... the lamb stole the show. The portion is ridiculous as they gave 8 pieces and it was juicy, tender and delicious. It was perfection along with the mint jelly. The great thing about Gibbs's is that the sides are included. So you don't have to spend another $8-$12 per side like most steak houses that are comparable. If you don't understand my post... get the lamb!  :)

Excellent service, good food. Nice little touches like lemon sorbet to clean the pallet, pickles and amazing bread served right away. Beautiful atmosphere, and the working AC! Definitely would come back.

This place is as quaint as it's food is delicious. It is very cozy and the tables are plentiful but to stacked on top of one another.  Our server was peasant and efficient. The food was stupendous starting with a eel made bourbon old fashioned.  The gazpacho has a nice balanced and fresh flavor.  The sod was crisp, cold and topped with a flavorful garlic vinaigrette. The filet was perfectly cooked to medium. The baked potato was just the right combo of flavors to set it apart from a regular baked.  The chocolate dessert was a slice of sinful richness. Such an awesome spot to try while visiting this awesome city.
We didn't pay for the meal or see the prices. The food was incredible we had the rib eye steak and three lobster tails. They were as good as any find dining restaurant I have gone to.

We decided to come here after reading all of the reviews and wanting to go somewhere very good for our last night in Montreal. From the outside the building looks quiet and small, but once we walked in we were surprised to see that it was not only full, but a very large restaurant. The dining room has a homey feel to it, like it's a popular local mom-and-pop place. The service was excellent and we really enjoyed the complementary bread, butter, bacon pieces, and pickles. The pickles were especially good - very vinegary and salty. Drinks were also great, and so was the French onion soup, although it was sweeter than I like. Portion sizes are huge here, so don't get carried away like we did. I thought the salad that came with dinner would be a normal side salad size, but it was huge - almost a meal in itself. The steak was great and cooked perfectly, and the swordfish came with a Cajun seasoning that was pretty spicy and good.We didn't have any room for dessert and left very happy (and with leftovers). While paying the bill I talked to the waitress and she explained that almost everything is made in-house, including desserts, pickles, and bread.Definitely worth a stop, especially if you're very hungry.

Dined here on a recent business trip.  My co worker really wanted steak, but ended up ordering the lobster tails. I had the salmon trout, which was excellent.  Best of all, we loved the service.  Our server was a hoot.. she even kept filling our bread basket with those amazing rolls and didn't care.  The pickles were delish as well.  The place itself is rather dark, but the outside is very well preserved for being an old stable and all.  Overall a very solid choice.

Rated one of the best steakhouses in Montreal, for what, I'm not sure. I must admit the location is prime: right in the heart of Old Montreal and the restaurant has been there for a very long time. I guess that's why people like it so much. 1- ordered a half a dozen of oysters, one of them was a bad oyster (could have gotten poisoned). 2- my bloody Cesar was probably one of the worst I've ever drank. 3- waiter took 5-10 minutes each time I asked him for something.4- the fillet minion was ok. Definitely not worth the money. It's overpriced and overrated. 2 stars because the valet driver was amazing.

Amazing dinner. I came here with my husband to celebrate his birthday while in Montreal, based on a colleague's recommendation. I loved everything about this place! The ambience is very nice and romantic. Looks kind of cave like inside. The servers and hosts were very friendly. To start, they give you a fresh loaf of bread with butter and pickles. Yum! Our entrees came with a salad which was delicious as well. We ordered the filet mignon and rib steak. Both were accompanied by Monte Carlo (which is a baked potato twice baked with bacon, sour cream, and chives) and asparagus. I was soooo full before the entree but HAD to finish the Monte Carlo because it was Soo good. I would totally recommend anyone in Montreal to come here for a good steak dinner! Free valet parking too!

Place was just OK. Nothing spectacular, nothing bad. But I'm not coming back.Should have avoided the place after seeing the tour bus stop up front. Maybe it was the crowd but the place was really noisy. Don't expect to be able to have a conversation unless you want to shout.Food was a bit overpriced. We had steaks and fish. Fish wasn't the most fresh. Steak was ok. Better places and better value for money at places down the street.
Great steaks and service! We will be back the next time we are in Montreal. The lime sorbet was a nice touch! Portions are quite large so come with an empty stomach

Service was great - the complete opposite of the food!  My wife and I's steaks (filet and bone in rib-eye) tasted like they had been used as the leather sole of a pair of shoes worn around for a days walk on the cobblestone streets of old Montreal (for the whole weekend).  The flavour (or lack thereof) was similar to licking the top of a crushed pepper shaker.  Dill Pickles, salad and Monte Carlo potato were the best (which doesn't take much).  Save your $150 and go to a steak house whose quality standards match that of most upscale steakhouses from this century.

Normally I like to talk about the food first, which is top notch here. But I must say that my favorite thing on the menu here is a dessert, item. First of all they make their own ice cream here which is one of the best I have ever had. Do yourself a favor and order the crepe jubilee. Homemade cherry sauce with vanilla ice cream rolled crepe. This is the best dessert I have had.Then not to forget the beef wellington is great here. Just remember they give you big portion size so remember to leave room for dessert.Great restaurant.

Excellent restaurant! The service was exceptional and the food was even better. If you're looking for fine dining without the exorbitant pricing, Gibbys is the place for you. While you will pay more on average compared to other restaurants, it's well worth the price of admission and you'll leave full & satisfied. The steaks savory & succulent, cooked to perfection and tailored to your preferences.

I was in Montreal for work and my coworkers and I decided to go here because of the reviews. Honestly, I thought this place was overrated and over priced. I love steakhouses, but I was utterly disappointed with the flavor and taste of it. It was a little lackluster.Foodwise, I ordered the French Onion soup which was okay. I've had way better. The top was too burnt and for an onion soup, the flavor wasn't there. It was just okay. My coworker and I split the Canadian lobster tail and the Gibbys ribeye steak to try the best of both worlds. So, portions were massive! For the price you are paying, I sure hope so. The lobster was good. It was cooked well, the butter sauce was good and I had the double baked potato which I think was the best thing I ate out of everything. The steak was a great piece, but as I've mentioned, the flavor didn't really hit me. I was expecting more, especially with all the great reviews from others - but I was disappointed.The ambiance was pretty cool. It's a busy place so expect to be there for a couple of hours. We were there probably for 4. If you want an over priced, average steak, this is the place for you.

First time at Gibbys and I loved it, I loved the atmosphere and the food was amazing.My first time eating lobster and it was honestly the best meal I've had in my life, the waiter was really friendly and nice.I, 100%, recommend this place if you're looking for a nice romantic date.

We were in Montreal for 7 days and ate here 2 of them - that's how good it is.  It reminds me of an old style chop house with wait staff in formal looking clothing, tableside preparation and a big menu. Service was good although a little slow at times but it's a huge place and the staff were doing all they could.  One nice thing is that there isn't a "it's not my table" philosophy - if a staff member is near you they will check in to see if you need anything.  We didn't pack dressy clothing and felt perfectly comfortable in slacks and nice shirts. I've read some of the negative reviews on here and my response to them is check out the menu before you go.  If they serve something you like you will be very pleased, if it's not what you're looking for, go somewhere else but don't blame it on the restaurant.

On a 3-1/2 week vacation through Canada, this was THE BEST MEAL of the entire trip.My meat was perfect, my potato was perfect, my "adult beverage" was perfect.I don't know what else to say.  If you enjoy it, if it's delicious, it's a great meal.  Remember, I was on a cruise ship for 3 weeks, famous for good food, and THIS was my favorite meal.
Loved everything about this place. Great food, excellent wait staff and a great place to have a birthday dinner. Will make a point of going back next time I am in Montreal!
Just another steakhouse nothing special. The Gibby's cut is pretty overrated.
This place was awesome! Everything we ate was fantastic. Steak was great. Still think about the escargot. Highly recommend!

For the past three years that I go to montreal I make it a stop to come here. As of lately i have been stop eating as much meat and their Chicken Kiev it's amazing !! My husband gets the steak and loves it every time. If you have the chance to pass by montreal and I go I say it's worth it for a dinner date

I came to gobby's on the recommendation of the hotel front desk trainee. It's interior is nothing fancy. The food and service, however were tops. The best onion soup one can expect to find in Montreal, or anywhere else in the world.  The bone-in ribeye was excellent and service very good.  Gibby's is definitely a place to put on the must-come-back-to list.

Bread...lots and lots of warm delicious Gibby's bread. Gibby's is a Montreal institution. The atmosphere is incredibly unique as the restaurant is in a 200+ year old stone building in old Montreal. It's great bang for the buck, your meal comes with amazing bread, pickles, coleslaw, the signature Gibby's salad and yummy mint chocolates at the end. The steaks are very good and they have an amazing Clam Chowder. The ambiance is a bit dark and the restaurant is huge so there's always room but it never hurts to make a reservation especially on the weekend.

We reserved a nice quiet corner upstairs, but got sent to the basement. The waitress seemed rushed and annoyed. My bf ordered beef wellington (medium) but came with a pulse! (rare!!).The halibut was sorta dry. The presentation was nothing special. A huge piece of broccoli covering the rest of the plate. To top it all off, during our salad a HUGE "centipede" crawled along the wall right next to my right hand. Scaring the cr*p out of me! my bf had to kill it in order for us to continue our meal. They did offer us a digestif as compensation. But overall horribly over priced for the quality / presentation of the food. Let alone the disgusting carpet I am sure they can afford to change considering the price they charge for the food.

We had Christmas dinner at Gibby's, and experienced some lapses in service during our time there. The food was generally good. The grilled Arctic char and gibby's cut of steak were cooked well and pretty delicious. The Monte Carlo potato and the chocolate delight was yummy too! Portions were humongous. However, the escargot, Gibby's salad, gazpacho and creamed spinach were so-so and could be skipped. The wine we ordered was not bad, but we later discovered it was priced at least 3x the average commercial price for the bottle. The ambiance was also generally good. We were not rushed and were able to have good conversations and sufficient privacy. In terms of service, my friend who ordered the lamb rack got her order delivered wrong twice. Once it was overcooked to the point of being difficult to separate, the next time it was delivered almost blue inside. While our waitress was courteous and did all she could, including offering a complimentary dessert for this, these mess-ups at the kitchen side still delayed our dinner considerably and made it awkward for my friend who felt bad returning the food, and who either felt compelled to finish her meal fast or sit awkwardly without her dish while waiting for a replacement. We also experienced an incident at coatcheck, with a friend's gloves and metro card falling out of her pocket during the time. Luckily she realised her gloves were gone before we left and returned for it. The coat check lady clearly knew that the gloves had fallen out of someone's pocket as she was able to quickly retrieve the gloves from the front desk, but she had not proactively displayed the gloves or asked if anyone had lost their gloves. My friend only realised her metro card was also missing when we reached the metro station after a grueling walk in the ice and snow. We called Gibby's to request they do a search and confirm if it was with them. Gibby's front desk was rude and curt, and said they would call back IF they found the card only. As I explained that we would want to know WHETHER they found the card or not as we were waiting at the metro station and would walk back immediately if so, Gibby's front desk initially refused to do so but later cursorily said that they would. We spent some time waiting at the metro and eventually decided to just repurchase a metro card as it was late and cold. We never got a call back from them. Those incidents really ruined our Christmas night, which was a pity given that we spent quite a lot at this restaurant (almost half a thousand for a group of 6) and had looked forward to it as our festive treat for our trip. Therefore I feel extremely ambivalent about recommending this restaurant or returning again.

Top notch food and an incredible atmosphere. This place is hard to beat. It's beautiful, quaint in an old world style. The food is very good, absolutely exceptional to be frank, and worth the money it will cost. Well worth the visit if you're in Montreal, I go every time I head up there. I never miss a chance to get to Gibbys. I can't imagine that it won't be one of the finer dining experiences while your in Montreal.

We traveled from Dallas to visit Montreal and chose Gibby's for my husband's birthday dinner. I don't think we could chosen a more perfect place. The service, from everyone was incredible. I even messed up our reservation time, and the team worked us in quickly and with a smile. And if the service was a 10 out of 10, the food was a 15 out of 10! Everything from appetizer to dessert: perfection. I highly recommend a visit for all ages!

Interesting restaurant, only a 3 star because they have a "full bar" but not able to make any drinks.Black Manhattan- noBoulevardier- noOld fashioned? Yes but not able to do it correctly. No orange peel or anything.Crappy beer selection, and basically come for the food, don't expect a good cocktail before dinner.

This restaurant is awesome!! Excellent service, the waitress was extremely friendly and even helped me choose my steak entree. It was absolutely delicious!! Cooked and seasoned perfectly.  The ambience is also to be mentioned. The wood beams and exposed brick give this place a cozy feel. They provide sorbet to cleanse your pallet and their homemade mint chocolate at the end of the meal is a wonderful treat! I highly recommend this establishment. Order the ribeye!

When asking the hotel concierge what was the best steakhouse in town, they said Gibby's. After securing a reservation for us, we took an Uber and we were so excited from the moment we saw the charming restaurant. The stone building held the traditions of a great restaurant. The menu is full of choices but it seemed clear to us to get the additional lobster tails with our steak which based on pictures on Yelp and our server, it was good enough for 2 people. The steak was a little more well done than the medium rare we ordered but it was good nonetheless. The lobster was tender and came on top of rice which we did not order but accompanied the lobster well. The baked potato with all the fixins already blended together in the potato is worth trying. It was my birthday and it was so sweet when our server took a picture of me and gave it to me in a Gibby's picture holder. I will not forget this delicious celebratory meal in such a historic atmosphere, friendly staff and wonderful food.
Incredible food and great service. Loved our steaks and lobster. Cocked perfectly and served correctly. 2 thumbs up.

I've been here a few times but last week I went two nights in a row. Thursday I went with my colleagues. I started with the Gibby's salad, the rib eye steak and the Monte Carlo potato followed by the blueberry cheesecake. The steak was ok but the cheesecake was very good! It's not too sweet and it's pretty big and filling!On Friday, one friend n I had the beef wellington with the Monte Carlo potato. The first time I had it, it blew my mind!! The pastry was crispy and the inside was nice and tender! It was perfection! Since then it honestly hasn't been as good at it was the first time but it is still my favorite thing on the menu. However that night, the waitress gave my friend a beef wellington cooked medium-well, which was not what she had asked for but when she cut it it was actually more on the medium rare side which was what she wanted. Whereas I asked for medium rare and it looked more rare than medium rare. We still ate it and it was still tender but it wasn't cooked the way we wanted it. Our friend had the rack of lamb. It was breaded and very tasty. We let them know in advance that it was our friend's birthday and they provided a whole vanilla cake for free. They also took a polaroid of the group and they gave it to us...it's a nice little souvenir. The service on Friday wasn't as good as the service on Thursday. In general I did notice that the service is a lot better during the week when there are less people, which I guess makes sense. For example, it took awhile for the waiter to fill our glasses of water on Friday and we had to refill our own wine glasses but on Thursday our glasses of water and wine were always filled. One time I went and the waiter was so nice and gave me extra bacon for my leftovers and extra chocolate mints to bring home which I really appreciated. Normally I really enjoy the service here. Gibby's is good but I wouldn't say it is the best steakhouse in Montreal.

Probably the best steakhouse in Montreal in a beautiful, classic and upscale dining area. Attentive and very professional service. I take my steak medium (rib eye) and on both my visits to Gibbys, the steaks were absolutely perfectly cooked to my exact order. Slightly crispy on the outside and nice and pink, moist and flavorful on the inside. Wow!! The rib eyes are huge (about 400gr) and come with a side of salad or a baked potato. I went for the salad and left feeling very full and satisfied. I only wish I took some pictures to attach to this review, just to demonstrate how absolutely sublime my steaks were.

Excellent service and food! We had Valerie who served our table. She is the best! Always on the beat and understand quickly our request. I ordered Guibby's cut and my mom ordered New York cut. Both steaks are amazing! And the sorbet is just devine. Even the free bread and pickles are delicious! This meal definitely worth the price and we will come back.

The food is fine, I don't think you will be disappointed BUT it is almost as if they don't respect their customers anymore. The place has become shabby and dirty. Many of the chairs are literally on its last leg. The bathrooms are rarely clean. The restaurant is busy.... perhaps a good idea is to tidy the toilets a couple times a night. The carpet on the steps is so old and down right GROSS. The service is factory style, polite but impersonal. A fine steakhouse charging the prices that Gibbys does should be the whole package; good food but also great service and a clean and well maintained restaurant.

Great steak place!I ordered the snails to start. Fantastic! Not too creamy but had a great flavour!The. I had the rib steak with salad and Monte Carlo potato. The steak was so big! It can be easily shared by two people. I got it medium rare. And it was fantastic! Its seasoning was perfect and the steak itself was juicy and tender. The potato was awesome too, must try!We got the cream puff thing for dessert, it was a nice ending to our meal. I also have to mention their excellent service. There was a small portion of lemon sorbet serviced after the appetizer to cleanse your taste buds and get you ready for your main course. And there was a bowl of water served after the main course for you to clean your hands. Sweet!Anyway, we had a great experience at Gibbys.

I started with the French onion soup which was excellent.  it is by far my favorite soup,  and they do a great job with it.  The ribeye was awesome and so was the twice baked potatoe. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Brilliant! My work colleague had the Beef Wellington and I, Steak Diane. Both were cooked to perfection. Served with twice baked or was it thrice baked potatoes, asparagus and roasted red peppers. Beautiful.

We are tourists in Montreal for a few days. My wife wanted a steak and Gibby's was listed on the hotel restaurant list. We were a little concerned about what would be acceptable attire since we were running around the port all day and didn't even bring dressy clothes. At Gibby's, you can go and be comfortable in shorts & a golf shirt (like me), jeans, dressed up or anywhere in between.The building and decor are phenomenal, even if you show up without reservations (like us) and upstairs is full...downstairs is really nice also!The wait staff were very professional, but would read the tables and be goofy / humorous if that was how your party was. We had Michel as our server and his interactions with us and busting my 14 year old son's chops was wonderful, but all still with superb service. The food was great; two of us had Chicken Kiev which was really good, one Beef Wellington which was cooked to perfection and very tasty, and one teriyaki steak which was a thick, juicy and perfectly prepared medium. Deserts were also outstanding!This restaurant is not cheap, but compared to lower quality places nearby, the slightly higher price is well worth it since you get such a higher quality meal and service. Kudos!!

Went here after many friends telling me this place was excellent and I have to say I was quite disappointed. My steak arrived over cooked when I asked for medium rare. By the time I got the plate back I wasnt even hungry anymore since I had stuffed myself with the Monte Carlo potato and the bread at the beginning. Moishe's is definitely better. Not sure I would give them a second chance.

I loved this place! This was one of the best dinners I have had in months. This place is old fashioned and reminded me of the type of steak houses my grandparents used to take me to as a kid. I love the value for the amount and quantity of food they give you. I had the mustard rack of lamb. The lamb tasted great and was cooked perfectly. The entree came with a delicious fresh salad, the monte cristo baked potato which was delicious, and perfectly cooked fresh broccoli. I had a bit of my friends rib eye and it was one of the best steaks I have had. The homemade chocolate dinner mints at the end were a nice touch. This place does dinner right and it tastes amazing. I'm making another trip to the city soon just to eat here again!

By far the worst restaurant we have been to, we travel a lot and visit many restaurants, but this takes the trophy of worst steak, and service. We ordered 3 steaks and some shrimp and a bottle of wine. The steaks were over cooked the first time so we didn't get to taste them. Then they came back and they tasted like low quality oily steak. The shrimp tasted like one big garlic, the server was no where to be found so we had to get up and find croutons, napkin, and silver ware. Oh and to top off our night they spilled steak bloody sauce all over our white $4000 leather jacket and shirt.The nastiest restaurant, and worst steak in our life! They said they would clean the jacket; but they didn't follow through, and even then white leather doesn't clean that  well when the stain is blood and steak sauce!!!

Me and my Wife celebrated our anniversary at Gibbys and had an absolute great time! Portions were amazing and the food quality was top notch. Highly recommend This restaurant to anyone wanting to have a great candlelight dinner. They also sent us away with a full cake after learning it was our anniversary!!

The best steakhouse in Montreal hands down. I got a medium rare filet mignon steak it was amazing! Tbh you don't need to order anything else besides a main dish! They give so much extra food besides the main! I had a house salad which was amazing with they're croutons. They also serve amazing bread with this cottage cheese dip and amazing pickles reminded me of Home!  With the steak I ordered the mashed potatoes it was so creamy and good .My boyfriend had a steak with a bone and it was the best marbleized steak with so much flavor pouring out of it. I really recommend gibbys for any occasion. They're vibe and food is over the top!!!!

Was in Montreal with friends and decided to go after reading reviews. I liked the food. Not the most amazing food ever but I gave it a 5 because the service is amazing which makes the food taste better. I would def go back.

First time visitor.  Just arrived to montreal with my wife from toronto.  We've been looking forward to the food here for quite some time.  We were incredibly impressed with everything tonight.  The atmosphere is excellent.  The portions are generous and more importantly tasty.  We really appreciated the mid meal lemon sorbet to cleanse the pallet and the minty dark chocolate at the end of the meal. The steak was a bit on the garlicky side but we agreed to the extra topping.  Will definitely be coming back!
it's fine if you aren't paying. the service is good. it's a special ocassion kinda vibe restaurant. The quality of steak etc.. just doesn't justify the price.
Had the rib steak. Classic steakhouse with good services. All around great food and reasonable pricing. Location  is great

On one of my walks through Old Montreal, I happened to stumble upon this "horse-stable-turned-restaurant" built in parts, between 1694 to 1850 and decided right away that this is where I wanted to have my anniversary dinner with my husband that same week. Very, very happy with our choice, the location is beautiful, the service was impeccable and the food is fantastic! All the staff were also very friendly and accommodating in making sure we got exactly the type of wine we wanted. Was a lovely anniversary dinner.

AMAZING FOOD plus the service and ambiance are incredible, too. Bar upstairs to drink while you wait for seating. Definitely try the oysters and lobster - to die for! The sorbet in between dishes really helps clear the palate and the pickles with bacon bread is a unique and yummy starter.

To say this place is amazing is an understatement. The food, service and ambience do not disappoint! Our waiter Linda was amazing ! She is one of those rare gems who loves her job and loves people and it shows. The food was delectable but make sure you have a big appetite as portions are quite big! The prices  are a little heftier  but I would say it is worth every penny. The lobster was the most scrumptious, buttery deliciousness I have ever had in my life! Definitely a must try for a night out in Montreal. We even made reservations the day of.

I really wanted to love this place. It was my husband's birthday and he loves steak and apparently Gibbs's is an institution. The atmosphere was something from the 70's, and seemed dingy and dark. While the portions were large, nothing was very tasty. It all seemed like something from a 80's era Sizzler.  My kabob's were cooked to my request but lacked flavor. The Gibby's salad was just a standard salad with a basic dressing, not sure why everyone raves about it. They did provide a huge amount of pickles at beginning of the meal, which my husband appreciated. They also provide a palate cleanser of lemon sorbet (too sweet) between servings.  The recommended wine was barely palatable. Our waitress was kind but she had so many tables to attend to, we hardly saw her. For more than 250 CAD$ I expected delicious and just got ho hum.

We had a wonderful dinner tonight. I had the Beef Wellington. My son had the rib steak. My wife and daughter split a huge piece of Arctic Char. All meals came with a generous salad, twice baked potatoes, sorbet, asparagus and other items. We had escargot and shrimp bisque for appetizers. Everything was cooked perfectly. The service was terrific, friendly but not too over-the-top. We had mentioned that we were visiting Montreal for my wife's birthday and they brought her a birthday cake, not a piece of cake, nor a cupcake, complete with candle. A very nice touch. We left totally satisfied and grateful that we make the trip to Gibby's.The building is beautiful exposed stone. Although the tables are close together, the room was not too loud and we could talk with the others at our table.A wonderful experience!

This is an expensive restaurant, but I highly recommend to go if you are visiting and/or you are a meat lover. We went for dinner in a Friday night, we booked 3 hours before so I cannot complain about that. We didn't have the best table, but the ambiance inside is very good wherever you are sitting. The restaurant is very cozy and warm and you really feel like back in the days when you are inside.About the food... I'm a steak lover, so when we arrived and saw the menu I was pleased to see that many options. The rib steak "gibby's cut" is amazing! I loved it and it was perfectly cooked. The portion was huge and the sides complements were also well served.We ordered creme brûlée for dessert and it was also not disappointing at all.The menu appetizers looks good as well, but if you are having a steak do not order anything extra or you will not finish everything.Service was not the best, but in a Friday night there're not too many restaurants that can offer excellent service; it was not bad at all, but for the price you're paying, of course you expect an excellent service.This is my best recommendation for a steakhouse in Montreal so far, I will definitely come back!

If you're cost-conscious, just share an entree with someone because Gibby's portions are quite big.  So there's no excuse to skip Gibby's if you're in Montreal, no matter the budget.  Everything we've tried are good (lobster tail, gibby's cut, lamb chop, nova scotia lobster).  Bread always taste fresh and goes great with the optional bacon bits and pickles that are also on the house. The potatoes, salad and asparagus that accompany the entree were always great.  Gibby's cut makes steaks from other Montreal restaurants look like a joke.  The difference is unmistakable.

Despite coming on a busy night during Labor Day weekend, we were seated after about a half hour. Large portions. You definitely won't leave hungry. Attentive service, hard working staff. The food was very good, however our steak was cooked a bit under from what was requested. Garlic shrimp and crab cake were absolutely amazing. I wish that there was a more extensive drink menu though. They offer mostly wine. When I asked for a gin martini, I was given gin and St. Germaine in one glass and then a separate glass with grapefruit juice. My boyfriend had a similar "2 cup drink" situation as well for his drink request.

If you're looking for a really proper, old school, steak house, this is it. The steak is fantastic, and they have Wellington on the menu which is such a delight. This is not a fine dining steak house, nor is it a secluded date spot, but it is a great place to have a very good meal. In fact, the steak here was better than most of the steaks I've had at "upscale" steak houses.To be honest, they got me at the bacon and homemade dill pickles (which you get as soon as you sit down). I even bought a bottle of the dills to bring home with me. True story.

Vibe = ehh... sort of crate and barrel-esq which isn't what we expected. Steak was good but seafood wasn't as good. Service was amazing. They had our table ready immediately, we didn't like the corner they put us in and they were happy to change us to another table. Our waitress Nancy was amazing. She made us feel so special as we were there to celebrate my moms birthday. She brought a cake and took a photo of us which they printed and gave us at the end of the night. Overall great experience.
Great atmosphere, amazing food, really great service. Trip to Montreal is not complete without Gibby's. Their potions are generous and it was worth every penny! Will definitely go back.

Was recommended to us as one of the best steak houses in Montreal.  We ate downstairs, which had a nice ambiance with stone walls, but was very loud.  Not sure if they had the a/c on as it became very warm as the night progressed.  Good wine selection, especially if you are a French wine fan.  I had the oysters Rockefeller, which were well executed--not too much spinach and breading, which is too often the case at other establishments.  I had the rack of lamb, very nicely presented with mint jelly. Very tender.  My wife had the eggplant parm, which she said was tasty. For desert, she had the creme brûlée.  The custard was perfect, but the sugar topping was not crunchy as it should be.  I had the chocolate desert, which was over the top.  A little pricey, but not to the point where you question the value.  The place could use a little freshening up in terms of the carpeting.

Went here for business meal in mid December and the place was packed.  We were able to get a table for 6 but quarters were tight.  There were some very energetic and interesting waiters & waitresses but, ours was soft spoken but attentive.  Gibby's is in a 200 year old building with a rich history ... tall people need to be very careful. The historic building and old world charm of the restaurant really makes you feel like you're in a different time.  But, the menu prices brought me right back to 2015 (a strong US dollar helped make it reasonable).  The food lives up to the reputation as a high end chop house.  We all had steaks of some kind and everyone enjoyed.  Starting with the fresh baked bread that keeps getting replace with a full loaf and the famous Gibby's salad - which comes with anchovies and is similar Caesar.  Both were delicious.  I had the Beef Wellington rare.  My first time trying this dish and it was terrific.  They use a filet cut that was so fresh, it actually came across as almost tasteless.  The mushroom & pastry coating were great. But, the mushroom gravy was amazing.  If it was appropriate, I would have drank some straight from the gravy boat.  Bottom line is that Gibby's is a high end restaurant in a historic part of old Montreal.  It's a fancy place and you pay "fancy prices."  But, the food is very good & worth the money. And, the atmosphere is worth a visit for a special occasion

I can't say enough great things about this restaurant. From London Ontario my Boss told me we just had to go. The service was beyond perfect. Impeccable service from everyone. Ps the pickles are to die for.
Lovely and romantic environment, server was very nice. We order steaks. That was very very good. You must try it if you come Montreal

This is a classic steakhouse in old Montreal. I'd not been to Montreal in bout 5 years. The weather was miserable (cold, rain/snow mix) & the parking was difficult but we endured!! I had a 6oz Petite Filet. The reason I gave them a 5* is because they nailed the steak!! It was done precisely the way I wanted it cooked. The Monte Carlo potato which was indescribable delicious. One more thing....the giant garlic dills are wicked. So thick..almost a meal in itself.
Great meal! We were told by everyone we asked to try Gibby's. They were all right. Food was wonderful as was the service. A definite must if you're in Montreal.
The food was amazing. We both had the filet mignon. Cooked to perfection. The service was very good. The mushroom tarte was an amazing appetizer. Gazpacho was just ok. Will definitely return.

We used to come here years ago when it felt like stepping into the home of a wonderful French chef, now it is just cranking out meals riding on its name amongst us tourists having lost part of its soul. We have always lived nearby, visiting occasionally since I was young. Now over priced and past its prime. Our asparagus turned into inedible broccoli (a menu change due to availability perhaps, we did not ask), our meals not memorable as the ones from years past had.

First time dining at old port and it was an amazing experience. Service was really great and friendly. Would definitively go again probably once a year since i dont have a job hahaha but yes the food was delicious. Salad comes as an apettitzer along with sorbets to cleanse your taste. I ordered the beef wellington, the beef was really tender and the sauce was compatible with it.

Gibby'sIn an ancient stone conventOnce a hospital By the riverWhere French is musicTo my earsThe beams of wood know stories I would like to hearOf anniversaries and partiesLove affairs Fond memories of friendsWaitress almost too tall for the low ceilingsWaiters accommodating and promptA family with a beautiful babyHer older brother carries a toy guitarA mother who gazes at her sonShe is laughing because His story, so funny Is true

CAN'T HANDLE STRESS!  Ordered Filet, cooked medium, came well done and very charred!  Then asked to get Beef Wellington, cooked medium, came rare.  Contacted management, and while apologetic, explained that it was a busy night for them.   Far from world class!
It is a very nice traditional Steakhouse in Montreal. Food, service and the atmosphere of restaurant are so impressive. Especially Wellington Steak and Rib Steak are delicious! Love this place!

Our overall experience at Gibbys was good, but over priced.  Orders at our table included the ribeye, the New York strip, and Beef Wellington. All the dishes were in the $50+ range, and while good, did not seem worth the price. What was excellent was the service; our waiter took very good care of us.

This elegant, long-standing restaurant is housed in a 200 year old stable by the waterfront in Old Montreal. I've only been here on rare occasion, for special celebrations, and the last time was over 30 years ago. I brought my daughters here tonight so they can experience one of the city's finer establishments. And I was so glad at it was just as I remembered it to be: gentile and refined with a sense of tradition and history the moment you walk in.First, how wonderful that they offer free valet parking. I made it known that we were just coming in for desserts and coffee, and they were still happy to park my car for me (note: as many may know, parking is a royal pain in the patootie on a busy Friday night at 8pm in the summer! And nearby lots cost $15 to park in them). We were told they could seat is in 30 minutes, so we strolled the old port and Place Jacques Cartier Square, marveling in the business and vibrancy of this great city. Upon returning to the restaurant, we were immediately seated. Tables clothed in white linens, leather-bound dessert menus at our seats. The waitresses were all dressed in period uniforms from the last century. Oh, and the food was divine! My youngest had the epitome of a chocoholic's fantasy: the Chocolate Delight,which was a decadent chocolate mousse-like cake with a crunchy chocolate topping, plated on a gorgeous swirled sauce. She said it was the best dessert she ever had. Meanwhile, my other kid and I shared the Crepe Cerise Jubilee: a thin, delicate crepe with vanilla ice cream with lots of cherries (and some blueberries). This was, hands down, the best dessert I've ever had. Ever. I was in heaven. My cappuccino was too strong for me, but my daughters enjoyed their French teas. And how lovely, to get some dark mint chocolate medallions on our table as a complimentary treat. Very lovely gesture.
Best meal that I've had in years. Definitely stop by if you want an affordable dinner experience in Montreal.

This was the finishing touch to an outstanding culinary experience in Montreal!  This is an exceptional steakhouse with great food and a very classy atmosphere.  We had a group of colleagues and everyone was very satisfied.  I started with the house salad which was simple but very good and went with the Gibby's cut for my entree.  This was such a flavorful steak and was cooked perfectly.  Per a recommendation from a colleague, I opted for the monte carlo potato to accompany the steak - I can honestly say this was the best riff on a twice baked potato I have ever had.  You have to try it!!!For desert, we shared the profiteroles and also had the Brazilian coffee.  Both were great and the preparation of the coffee was a show to watch!Our service was top notch throughout this great meal - was very happy to have visited and recommend everyone gives this a shot if they're looking for some great food and an even better experience!
Atmosphere is great. The service was impeccable. Our steak was a little drier than expected.

Cut to the chase - Gibbys cut rib steak was charred to perfection. It definitely had the soft crunch texture on the outside and tender on the inside bite. I normally go medium rare plus to medium on non dry aged cuts, especially ribeye, where the fat melts into the meat a little more. It's simple and flavorful. 20 oz bone in so go easy on the apps as the portions are of a bonafide steakhouse. The Monte Carlo potato was a big win with the steak. Essentially twice cooked mashed potato stuffed back into the skin. The dining room had all the steakhouse charm with a quaint touch of Old Montreal. Bread & pickles for the opening is pretty good too. Overall great steakhouse experience. The best of the best in Montreal. A plus for being in the quarters of Old Montreal ideal for casual family or a impressive date.

Great traditional steakhouse with plenty to choose from on the menu. Rib eye is delicious and cooked to perfection. Great atmosphere and excellent service. Seafood options are great and one of our guest said the halibut was great. You won't go Hungary here with the big portions. Will be back when we come to town.

Our favorite steakhouse on the planet! We make the  drive from Long Island every year, and while our list of restaurants to hit changes, Gibbys is always a staple.  It sounds funny but their pickles are damn good and served at every table with butter and bacon bits.  We got the grab cake appetizer and it was great! Had an aioli sauce with it.  The steak is just unbelievable.  I got the filet medium rare and it was cooked perfectly.  The atmosphere is really cool too.  Can't wait to go again next year.

While I'm not the biggest fan of steak I love some good seafood so when the chance arose to go to Gibby's I said why not.  Situated in Old Montreal the restaurant is housed in an old stable and offers a warm and cozy ambiance.  It also has complimentary valet parking which is good to note since parking in the area can be next to impossible sometimes. The portions here are HUGE so I opted to skip the appetizer.  Besides you also get a starter included with your meal (salad, tomatoes and onions or tomato gazpacho).  I opted for the gazpacho which despite being tomato based was loaded with lots of other vegetables such as green peppers which really upped the flavour of the dish.  Be warned though that there is lots of garlic in the gazpacho so it is not the best choice if you're there for date night!I opted to have the lobster tails as my main with a Monte Carlo potato on the side.  The Monte Carlo is a baked potato with sour cream, bacon and chives and it is definitely a cut above a normal baked potato.  The lobster just fell apart and when dipped in butter was like a little taste of heaven.I finished off with blueberry cheesecake for dessert and the texture was just right.  Also it didn't taste too rich.  The waiter also brought mint chocolates at this point too which was a nice way to finish off a good meal.The service was pretty good except for a couple of minor errors where they brought us the wrong items.  That being said they did correct the mistake quickly.  In the end it was a good meal but given the prices here it's the kind of place where you come to celebrate a special occasion.

I went to Gibby's for my birthday a few years ago and loved it. They made it so special for me and my friends. So I went back recently with my husband, had the same thing as the first time  (beef Wellington) and it was so awful. The Monte Carlo potato was amazing and thank god it was because it's all I could eat on that plate. Even the starter salad was disgusting, tasted like old leftovers from a dorm room fridge. This place is supposed to be legendary and for the price it should be every.single.meal. Never will I go back to this dated cave with bad beef.

Once again went to Gibby's on Christmas Eve with a few friends as we have done for the past several years.Food is very good.  Service was good.  We would have preferred to sit in the main dinning room.  That would have made the evening perfect.

According to a friend who is a local, Gibby's is an "institution." It is very old and very rustic, a classic steakhouse. I'm not a big steak eater so I ordered the Chicken Kiev. This was the first time I ever ordered this dish and the waitress had told me to be careful but I didn't quite catch on. My first cut through the chicken caused hot liquid butter to squirt out all over my brand new top. I was a mess! Our waitress, Nadia, was very nice and brought me some club soda. You live and you learn!The chicken was delicious, even after all that. My husband and our friend both enjoyed their steaks. We all shared the creme brûlée for dessert which was good, but nothing to write home about. I liked this place but since steakhouses are not really my thing, I will give it four stars.

Our taxi driver recommended this place and we decided to give it a try. I have to say that we definitely DON'T regret it. GREAT experience from the moment we walked in. We didn't have reservations, but they still got us in right away. Our waiter was great and prompt with service and anything we needed. From the warm bread and butter to the pickles to the delicious salad and finally our mouth-watering steak and fresh salmon- it was a GREAT experience. Everything was flavorful! Definitely coming back here if I visit again!

My hotel concierge recommended this restaurant, and it was late already so I didn't do too much investigating into it before I just sat down at a table. It's a very cozy, rustic Montreal steakhouse. The service was very good. The menu had mostly steak and fish options for entrees. Escargot and onion soup were good. Dinner was also good, just not fantastic. I felt it was over priced. I prefer trendier, more creative menus, so I think this place just wasn't for me as a tourist.

Delicious HUGE portions and wonderful wait staff! We also got the Brazilian coffee flambé, which was so cool so watch them prepare, delicious, and very alcoholic! Could easily share the coffee and entrees between two, but why would you when the prices are so reasonable!? Highly recommend!!

Steak was excellent.  Edmund, our server was even better.  Unfortunately we were seated right by a waiter stand and got to know several waiters by their butts.The constant clanging of dishes did not help either.  Good meal but pay attention to where you are seated!!!

Food was delicious, but service was really bad. Wanted to have a nice dinner for my bf's bday. We waited in the lounge for 30 mins, they never came to see us to serve us drinks. There's no bar to go up to order, there was only 2 waiters and they are walking by so fast not even looking. We order, at this point it's been an hour and we are hungry, brings bread no butter for another 15 mins. Wont go again, possibly bad timing, but for the amount I paid, i expected at least service while i was waiting in the lounge.

Must be the best steakhouse in the MTL.  Been here three times.  They cover all the cuts of beef and have lots of seafood as well.  The sides are classic with original touches added in.  Very good wine list and friendly service.  Mrs G and I agreed that the server was one of the best we have on memory.It is located in the olde city and the ambience is olde style steakhouse.  If a martini (gin and tonic, scotch and water, etc) followed by shellfish, salad, and steak appeals to you, this is a good haunt.

I took my parents to dinner at Gibby's in St. Sauveur on Christmas eve where we enjoyed our respective meals and left feeling very satisfied (read: roly poly stuffed!). Because I had been warned about their sizeable portions, I opted to skip the appetizer section; both my mum and I ordered the scampi, which were melt-in-your-mouth DELICIOUS. These were accompanied by rice, asparagus and a baked potato (either plain or Monte Carlo). The meal also included a starter (Gibby's salad, gaspacho or tomatoes/onion dish). I ordered the gaspacho (chilled, tomato-based blend of fresh vegetables and herbs), which was light and simple, though a bit on the garlicky side. My only complaint was that the bowl was too big! I would have been satisfied with half of what they gave me.  My mum ordered the salad, which was a bit plain but very fresh.  My dad started with grilled jalapeno sirloin sausage, served with mango chutney. I had a bite and found them to be nothing extraordinary. The only thing that stood out for me was how spicy they were, but the meat itself was lacking in flavour.  He then had the Rib steak (Gibby's cut), which he raved about for the rest of the night - fresh, full of flavour and about an inch thick.We ended the night by sharing profiteroles for dessert. This dessert is meant to be for one person, but it's huge - with the sizeable meal portions, there is no way I could have eaten 3 of those! They were good, but I'm pretty sure they were frozen, which was a bit disappointing.  The wine list was OK, but not great if ordering by the glass.Overall, a great meal, but a bit over-priced. The service was OK but not fantastic.  I recommend Gibby's if you want to treat yourself, or for special occasions. Get the scampi!

Very nice steakhouse. Expensive but you get what you paid for. Ambiance and decor is definitely old school, maybe a bit more crowded than I'd like with most of the way the tables are laid out, but we were a large party and sat towards the back in a slightly more spacious area. Steak was excellent, cooked perfectly. Pretty good drink selection too from beer to wines and also a full liquor bar.

Met some friend's here during the Grand Prix Weekend. The place was popping! Got here around 7:40 for our 8 PM reservation. They had the table ready and seated us on the spot. Ordered some drinks and a few appetizers. I had the escargot and they were perfect! For dinner I went with the swordfish that was fresh and delicious. My wife had the rib eye and it too was fantastic. Great flavor! It did seem kind of weird that the whole upstairs lounge looking area was empty. You'd think they would get a bigger kitchen and some more staff and fill that place up too when big events are in town.In any case it was delicious and the decor both in and out was very unique. Get a reservation on the weekends though because this place was BUSY!

2 stars is accurate for the experience we had especially since our stay in Montreal has been a culinary extravaganza. The good: Napa wine and crown ManhattansThe average: the service; wasn't up to par with every other restaurant we visited in terms of sincerity and helpfulness. The bad: my "Gibby cut" was overdone and my wife's fillet was underdone-they were sent back. We were 1 of 3 tables (that we witnessed next to us) that had "temperature" issues. The manager did not charge us for the Rockefeller oysters which, for sure, were made with an "Italian herb mix" because they smelled and tasted like pizza.  Also, I pointed out to the waiter that 1) there are lots of spider webs around the picture frames that have been there a while because of the dust build up, and 2) the centipedes crawling in and out of the old stone wall were...not appealing (another table next to us, they did not have temperature issues, said on previous visits that they have had centipedes jump from the wall onto their table). Unfortunately, we must have hit a bad night because the Yelp reviews are spectacular, plus, two different friends from home strongly recommended this place, but, we can't deny what we had or experienced...we do not recommend this restaurant nor will we return. I hate to write poor reviews, but, with the high quality of food and service we've experienced in the last week we cannot justify the risk of another sub par meal when the city is filled with fabulous cuisine.
The experience was fantastic. The ambiance was great the service was the best I've had. The food was better than average. Definitely a place to go for special nights.

My husband and I went to Gibby's as an early anniversary dinner on our trip to Montreal. We had made a reservation, so we were promptly seated (in the downstairs dining room).The service was fantastic - our waiter was very nice & funny and we didn't have to wait long for our food.I LOVED the free pickles on the table and the bread was delicious. The pewter places and costumey uniforms on the servers added a nice old-world charm. The entire place just felt so cozy.Food-wise, it's great. It's been a while since we went, but I'm fairly certain I can remember what we got!To start, I went with the Gazpacho and my husband got the salad. The croutons were AMAZING.We had planned on splitting a steak, but in the end, we splurged and each got the Filet Mignon (I got the petite). They were perfectly cooked and we both cleared our plates.For dessert, we split the Crème Brûlée and Gibbys Chocolate Delight (a medley of smooth, dark and crunchy).We were completely stuffed after, but it was totally worth it. I would DEFINITELY recommend Gibby's.
Beautiful location, very friendly staff.  Had the beef Wellington.  Amazing.  Large portion but so very good you just had to eat it all.  Very knowledgeable staff.

Awesome food. All served well presented. They have a valet service. Between courses you get sorbet, at the start of your meal you get bread, pickles and bacon. All the staff was extremely friendly. The flavour of food was unbeatable.

One of my favourite places in Montreal,  especially for out of towners.  A fancy restaurant without any pretention. If you want a Jewish steakhouse in Montreal this is it.The prices are high but include sides with your meal, unlike most steakhouses.  Choose the monte carlo potato, don't hesitate.  The Gibby's salad and the tomato salad are both good choices. Dont forget to add croutons and bacon.  The pickles and especially the bread put out on the table are delicious. Mouth currently watering for that slightly sweet and freshly warm bread.  I always used to get the crusted lamb.  The beef Wellington is amazing.  I recommend the fresh blueberry cheesecake for dessert.A great choice for an occasion where you want to feel special.

Gibbys used to be our go to steakhouse spot in town whenever there is an occasion or friends/family visiting. The quality of the meal dropped significantly over the past few months...would not go back...
Service was great. The steak was overdone slightly from medium rare, which made it really tough and dry.Otherwise the Monte Carlo potatoes was great. As was everything else besides the steaks.

10 stars out of 5!!! Oh my God is this place incredible! My husband and I were in Montreal a few weeks ago for a couple hockey games and we are lucky to have found this gem.  We wanted a delicious steak dinner and we got one. Gibby's has such a great steakhouse feel, the ambiance is perfect and their food is out of this world- even the bread and butter was amazing! We started with shrimp cocktail and the salads that came with dinner- both delicious. I ordered the Filet Mignon and added the Canadian Lobster Tail- absolutely incredible, the best best steak and lobster I have ever had.  My husband felt the same about his dish, he ordered the sirloin steak and loved it.  The waiter was great and service was amazing. This meal and experience was everything and more. We were so thrilled that we found the perfect steakhouse in Old Montreal- will definitely go back next time we are in town!

Good old fashioned steakhouse. If you're feeling nostalgic, then this place is for you.  It's trendy, with all the perks of an old world restaurant :)Steak and sides are very good. Salad is amazing.It's on the expensive side... So maybe best kept for special occasions.

As I work through my way of trying the best steak in Montreal this has remained the king. Suggest to get the Gibby's cut rib steak. Massive but so good. Unlike other steak houses that char the outside, they grill it properly. The bread, pickles are great as is the salad. The twice baked potato is quite delicious. Didn't like the beef sausages but who cares it's about the beef. Creme Brule was and still is one of the best I've had. Ambiance and service are both great.  Highly recommend going to anyone with the means.

I wish I could give this restaurant a better review, but sadly I cannot.  As a Gibby's patron for the last 30 years, I have always enjoyed my experience immensely, but I will not be returning to this once revered Montreal establishment. Our party waited over 45 minutes after our reservation time to be seated, and the host was incredibly rude, blaming us for not checking in with him, when we had gone to see him 3 times prior to being seated.  Several other patrons had been waiting 30 minutes past their reservation time as well.The manager unfortunately did not help matters.  Recognizing the issue at hand, he offered complimentary drinks or dessert, but his demeanour quickly became highly offensive when after providing the drinks, he said "Are you smiling now? Give me a smile." That said, the food and wait staff have always been and continue to be exemplary, but the host and manager have been enough to dissuade me from ever going back to a family favourite.  Very disappointing.

Good restaurant overall.  The creamed spinach was nice and the Monte Carlo potatoes with the entree was very good.  The steak was well marbled and had a good consistency was ok.  For a non-aged steak it was flavored well and cooked to the right temperature.  The palate cleanser before the main meal was a nice touch.

Wow! If you are ready to spend a little extra on a good dinner, go to Gibby's. House made pickles had my girlfriend almost full before we even started on dinner and the pretzel roll had me smiling. We ordered drinks, wine for her and a cocktail for me. Both were pleasing and mine was particularly strong. Dinner was Filet Mignon Wellington for me and I don't think it could have been better. A light flaky crust quickly have way to an expertly prepared steak. My girlfriend ordered the rib eye and it was just slightly over done (we still enjoyed about 80% of it). Dessert was perhaps the best I have ever had. Crepe filled with vanilla ice cream and topped with blueberries and raspberries had me full to bursting! The experience was capped with mints and was $20 less than we planned for. Highly recommended!
Spent New Years eve here, amazing staff friendly and nice. Also the food was really good with great flavor. We loved the Gibby's Cut steak and the Lobster Tail

Excellent service, food and decor. The old stable barn is quite the unique setting and provides great ambiance. The food was amazing: we had the sausage, shrimp and mushroom tart for appetizers and each one was superb. I had the petite filet and it was cooked perfectly. Highly recommend this place.

Gibby's is a very cozy steakhouse in a great location in old Montreal.  I stopped in with a group of coworkers and had a very pleasant experience.  The service was friendly and extremely professional.  This is probably the norm for steakhouses of this caliber, but I don't typically eat at places this fancy.I ordered the "petite" filet-mignon because I wasn't feeling too hungry, and that turned out to be one of the best decisions I've made in a while.  It was still a very large piece of meat and  I struggled to finish it.  A few of my coworkers got individual steaks that could have fed a family of four.  We also ordered a few bottles of wine which were all very good.Overall it was a good experience, and given its proximity to my hotel, I would likely return again.
Great food and service at this Montreal treasure! Located in old Montreal, this spot had a vast menu and provides a great dining experience from start to finish.

I'm planning on another trip to Montreal for the upcoming holiday  and a visIt must include a return to this old school Vieux Monttreal iconic landmark.A great location, Vieux (old) Montreal takes you to another world and centuries away even though you are only 90 miles from Burlington VTBut let's get back to the food...their steak done perfectly( Rib Eye is a favorite)  ample bread and as I recall fantastic pickles...and all reasonably priced.  We started with a Gibby's house salad and frankly the portions were so ample that  sides were superfluous. They are also known for  seafood if red meat isn't your thing.The ambience is old school steak house. A bit rustic..The wait staff attentive  and friendly.  In the heart of the most beautiful section of the city.Full bar...great old school cocktails...a nice wine list.. And the bill with tip was less than you'd expect...certainly the best value for your Canadian Dollar.I recommend a reservation...and get there early...have a drink upstairs while you wait.I suggest stay right in Vieux Montreal ... And become a Francophile ...Vous Aimerez Gibbys!

What a great restaurant. We went there on a Friday night, expecting a wait to be seated and another way to find a parking space. We were wrong on both counts. They have valet parking and we were seated immediately. Our waiter was extremely friendly and knowledgeable, considering my lack of fluency in French. The restaurant is in old town, sat in brick, which of the fashion of the area. The interior carries out the same thing in this relatively large restaurant. Although large, each table achieved a degree of intimacy. A unique feature of Gibbys is the fact that all dishes are served on pewterware. Never seen this before, but it did add an elegant touch. Uniquely, on the table was a bowl of sourdill whole kosher pickles and a small cup of bacon bits.For appetizers, my partner and I shared mussels Provençal and escargot. The former was outstanding and the latter excellent. We shared the rack of lamb, which was huge. They split the dish for us each receiving four lamb chops. They were just delicious. Even though it was split, each of us was allowed to pick our own side dishes. The baked stuffed potato was a standout. Even though we shared the meal, we were both too stuffed for dessert.All in all, this was definitely a five-star experience!

Over the top quality, great service. This is a must in old Montreal. It is old but what great ambiance.The calm chowder is a must, one of the best you will ever have. Beef Wellington is fantastic, my wife had the halibut and it was perfect as well.In Montreal do not pass up Gibbys

Great steaks, great wine, valet parking. I've  be been here a few New Years in a row, great family environment right by the fire works by the port of Montreal for the 12 o'clock hour. Reasonable high prices, if you compare to NYC or PHL it's in line. But for Canada it's expensive. Old chatoe  that is a restaurant. Very rustic but quaint. Love the place and excellent food.

Our visit to Gibby's last evening was simply mahvelous!  After a few opening cocktails, I had Gibby's salad along with a veal chop and the Monte Carlo potato. Ended the meal with Key Lime pie. The setting was cozy, the service was great and the food was delicious. Wonderful steakhouse.

We reserved a table here for my birthday, unfortunately I cannot review the food as we did not stay to eat, the restaurant was busy, so we went upstairs to the bar to wait for our table, the wait staff in the bar pretty much ignored us, eventually we were served, our drinks order was wrong twice, so third time lucky, every other table was given snacks, not us, not that we wanted to spoil our appetite, but to be offered rather than ignored, would have been nice, after 45 mins, no updates, many other arriving later being seated first, we paid for our drinks and left. Never again, they trade on a name made 25+ years ago, along with the decor, which has never been updated or cleaned since opening.

Just perfect, from polite valet parking to a professional waiter namer Rainor. The food is perfect. The meat is tender and remarkably tasty, the Monte Carlo potato is wonderful. The lobster is also remarkable. All in a pleasant setting with truly professional unhurried service. Wow....I grew up in this town and have been away for years. I come here when I visit family and what amazes me is how consistently good this restaurant is. It is world class...Bravo!!!

Went to Gibby's for our one year anniversary. We came from NJ and my wife and I are self proclaimed steakhouse connoisseurs. We where thoroughly impressed by a combination of the decor, service and quality of food. We started with the signature Gibby's salad which was great. My wife ordered the surf and turf and got the beef Wellington.  Both meals where executed to perfection and to put the icing on the cake the meals where not a la carte which is a great thing. I definitely recommend this place whenever in Montreal.

Friday night dinner... reservations at 8...promptly seated...the bread, bacon and pickles is a nice touch... the Gibby salad was very good and it was a large portion! I had the teriyaki steak with baked potato and my date had the filet and Monte Carlo potato... steaks were Devine! Potatoes were excellent as well. Dessert was key lime pie and Sherbet ... only drawback was the service was a bit slow and the waiter brought my pie but we waited 15 minutes on the sherbet.... in his defense he was dealing with a very large party... all in all highly recommended

In the heart of Old Montreal, off Rue Youville. Previous 18th Century Stable house. Three floors with a mix of modern/contemporary decor. Wood on inside with big fireplace. Stonewalls covered with beautiful vines on the outside. Patio closed today due to down pour of rain. Quite the fine dining experience! Service was on par with knowledgeable staff. Bathrooms located on top floor where there is a lounge or the bottom floor where there is rooms for lager group events. Knowing for their Rib-eye and strake- also has a seafood option. We started off with Fresh baked bread with creamy butter and large dill pickle. Your choice of wine or cocktail. Next can the Appetizers and ended up getting the regular green salad and others tomato /onion. Portions were not small- so pace yourself and be prepared to eat.
